ingredients.Name: chili flakes (adjust to your preferred level of spiciness)

directions.Direction: In a medium-sized pan, melt the unsalted butter over low heat. Allow it to soften without browning.
Add the chopped chives, thyme, lemon juice, chili flakes, fresh parsley, and minced garlic to the pan. Stir well to combine the ingredients with the melted butter.
Season the mixture with salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, and paprika. Adjust the seasoning according to your taste preferences.
Continue to cook the butter mixture over low heat for about 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally to blend the flavors.
Remove the pan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
Once the butter mixture has cooled down a bit, stir in the lemon zest and Dijon mustard. Ensure all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
In a mixing bowl, combine the prepared cowboy butter with softened cream cheese. Mix until smooth and well combined.
Transfer the cowboy butter and cream cheese mixture to a small container or jar for serving. You can also shape it into a log using plastic wrap for easy slicing later.
Refrigerate the dip until it firms up and is ready to serve. It will keep well in the refrigerator for several weeks.
Serve the Cowboy Butter Cream Cheese Dip with your favorite dippers such as crackers, breadsticks, or vegetable sticks. Enjoy the rich, tangy, and slightly spicy flavors of this unique dip.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Cowboy Butter Spread
Description: Cowboy Butter is a flavorful and zesty compound butter that perfectly balances the richness of softened unsalted butter with a medley of aromatic herbs, a kick of chili flakes, and the brightness of lemon. This versatile condiment offers a delightful blend of savory and slightly spicy flavors, making it an excellent addition to various dishes.

ingredients.Name: lean ground beef or ground lamb

directions.Direction: For the Filling:
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onions and cook until translucent.
Add ground beef or lamb to the skillet. Break it into crumbles and cook until browned. Drain excess fat if needed.
Season the meat with dried parsley, salt, and black pepper. Stir in Worcestershire sauce and minced garlic.
Push the meat to the side of the skillet and add cornstarch
Mix in tomato paste and gradually add beef broth while stirring to create a thickened sauce.
Add frozen peas and carrots. Simmer for a few minutes until the vegetables are heated through. Set aside.
For the Potato Crust:
Peel and boil the Russet potatoes until they're fork-tender. Drain and let them cool slightly.
Mash the potatoes with softened butter and a pinch of salt until smooth.
Gradually add cornstarch or potato starch while kneading the mixture into a pliable dough. Add a little water if the dough is too dry.
Divide the dough into equal portions and roll them into balls.
For the Assembly and Frying:
Take a ball of the potato dough and flatten it into a disc on a clean surface.
Place a spoonful of the prepared filling in the center of the disc.
Flatten another ball of potato dough into a disc and place it over the filling.
Seal the edges of the two potato discs together, enclosing the filling.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or deep skillet to 350°F (175°C).
Carefully add the filled potato assembly to the hot oil using a slotted spoon.
Fry until the crust is golden brown and crispy, about 4-5 minutes.
Use the slotted spoon to carefully remove the fried pie from the oil and place it on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Repeat the process for the remaining pies.

Place the French fry crusted Shepherd's Pies on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 10 minutes, ensuring the filling is heated through. Serve hot and enjoy this unique twist on a classic dish!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: French Fry Shepard's Pie
Description: French Fry Crusted Shepherd's Pie is a creative and delicious twist on the traditional Shepherd's Pie. It features a flavorful ground beef (or lamb) filling with onions, peas, carrots, and a rich sauce, all enclosed in a crispy crust made from mashed potatoes and cornstarch. The unique element of this dish is the deep-frying process, which gives the pie a delightful crunchy exterior reminiscent of French fries.

directions.Direction: Place the eggs in a medium-sized pot and cover them with water.
Bring the water to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to a simmer.
Let the eggs simmer for about 9-12 minutes for hard-boiled eggs.
Once cooked, immediately transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water to cool. This will stop the cooking process and make them easier to peel.
Gently tap the boiled eggs on a hard surface to create cracks all around the shell.
Carefully peel the eggs, keeping the cracks intact.
Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add a small amount of oil.

Once the oil is hot, add the peeled eggs and fry them, turning them occasionally, until they develop a golden-brown, crackled exterior. This will create the "tiger skin" effect. Remove the eggs from the pan and set them aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine the soy sauce, mirin, rice vinegar, gochujang, diced Thai chilis, diced garlic cloves, beer, sugar, and a pinch of salt.
Mix well until all the ingredients are thoroughly combined.
Place the fried eggs in a container or a zip-top bag.
Pour the prepared sauce over the eggs, ensuring they are fully submerged.
Seal the container or bag and refrigerate for at least 4-6 hours, or preferably overnight. This allows the eggs to absorb the flavors of the sauce and develop the signature "tiger skin" appearance.
Once marinated, remove the eggs from the sauce and cut them in half or serve them whole, as desired.
Optionally, strain the sauce to remove the diced chilis and garlic if you prefer a smoother texture.
Top with sesame seeds and green onions.
Serve the tiger skin eggs with the strained sauce on the side as a dipping sauce.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Tiger Eggs
Description:
Tiger Skin Eggs are hard-boiled eggs with a twist – their crackled, golden-brown exteriors resemble the distinctive pattern of a tiger's skin. These visually captivating eggs are achieved by frying boiled eggs until the shells develop cracks, creating a unique texture. The eggs are then marinated in a mouthwatering sauce, resulting in a savory delight that holds the flavors exceptionally well.

The sauce, a blend of soy sauce, mirin, rice vinegar, gochujang (Korean red chili paste), Thai chilis, garlic, beer, sugar, and salt, infuses the eggs with layers of taste. Marinating the fried eggs in this mixture allows them to absorb the bold flavors, transforming them into a delicious and visually stunning treat.

ingredients.Name: Salt and black pepper to taste

directions.Direction: Sprinkle salt and black pepper evenly over the beef tenderloin roast. Sear the roast in a hot pan with a little oil until all sides are browned. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Once the beef has cooled slightly, brush the entire surface with Dijon mustard. This will create a flavorful layer that complements the beef and helps the crepes adhere.
Lay the thin crepes out on a layer of plastic wrap or parchment paper. The crepes should be large enough to wrap around the beef tenderloin.
Add Prosciutto: Lay the slices of prosciutto over the crepes, covering them evenly. This adds a salty and savory element to the dish.
In a pan over medium heat, sauté the finely chopped mushrooms and shallots in olive oil until they release their moisture and become tender. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Set aside to cool.

Spread the cooled mushroom duxelles evenly over the prosciutto layer. Place the mustard-coated beef tenderloin in the center and carefully roll the crepes and prosciutto around the beef, using the plastic wrap to help you create a tight log. Once wrapped, keep the beef wellington in the refrigerator to firm up.
Roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface. The pastry should be large enough to wrap around the beef tenderloin log completely.

Remove the cling wrap from the beef tenderloin log, then place it in the center of the puff pastry. Brush the edges of the puff pastry with the beaten egg. Carefully wrap the pastry around the beef, ensuring it is sealed all around. Trim off any excess pastry if necessary.
Give the entire surface of the wrapped beef wellington an egg wash. This will give it a beautiful golden color when baked.

Preheat your oven to 220°C. Place the beef wellington on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Optionally, score a decorative design on the pastry with a knife. Bake for about 40 minutes or until the puff pastry turns golden brown and crisp. To ensure the desired doneness, you can use a meat thermometer to check that the center of the beef reaches 130°F for medium-rare.

Allow the beef wellington to rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thick portions. Serve with your favorite sides, such as roasted vegetables or mashed potatoes, and enjoy your delicious homemade Beef Wellington!
For the Crepes:
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and then add the milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract (if using). Whisk until well combined.
Slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, whisking continuously to form a smooth and lump-free batter.
Let the batter rest for about 15-20 minutes. This allows the flour to fully hydrate and results in more tender crepes.
Heat a non-stick crepe pan or a shallow frying pan over medium heat. You can also use a crepe maker or a regular frying pan with a little butter or cooking spray to prevent sticking.
Once the pan is hot, pour about 1/4 cup of the crepe batter into the center of the pan. Quickly tilt the pan in a circular motion to spread the batter thinly and evenly across the bottom of the pan
Cook the crepe for about 1-2 minutes or until the edges start to lift and the bottom is lightly golden.
Carefully flip the crepe using a spatula and cook the other side for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Transfer the cooked crepe to a plate and repeat the process with the remaining batter.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Beef Wellington
Description: Beef Wellington is a classic and elegant dish that features a tender beef tenderloin coated with a layer of savory duxelles (a mixture of finely chopped mushrooms and shallots) and wrapped in thin crepes, prosciutto, and puff pastry before being baked to perfection. The name "Wellington" is believed to have originated from Arthur Wellesley, the first Duke of Wellington, and the dish is said to have been created in his honor.

ingredients.Name: Glutinous Rice Flour or Potato Starch

directions.Direction: Peel the russet potato and chop it into chunks.
Boil the potato chunks in water until tender.
Drain the boiled potato and mash it in a mixing bowl using a fork or potato masher.

Add butter, salt, sugar, and glutinous rice flour (or potato starch) to the mashed potato. Mix until you have a cohesive dough. If the dough is dry and falling apart, add a small amount of water to achieve the right consistency.
Take a small chunk of the potato dough and flatten it in the palm of your hand.
Place a bit of shredded mozzarella in the center of the flattened dough.
Wrap the dough around the mozzarella, sealing it completely. Roll it into a bite-sized ball. Repeat with the remaining dough and mozzarella.
Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Make sure there's enough oil to submerge the mozzarella bites.
Once the oil is hot, carefully place the mozzarella bites in the pan using a slotted spoon or tongs.
Fry the bites until they are golden and crispy on all sides. This should take about 3-4 minutes.
Use the slotted spoon or tongs to remove the fried bites from the oil and place them on paper towels to drain excess oil.
For the Sauce
In a small bowl, mix together the chili oil and honey until well combined.
Serve the French fry mozzarella bites hot, alongside the chili honey sauce for dipping.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: French Fry Mozzarella Bites
Description: Indulge in the delightful fusion of flavors and textures with our French Fry Mozzarella Bites. These irresistible bites are crafted from a blend of tender russet potatoes, buttery richness, and a touch of sweetness, all enveloped in a crispy golden crust. Encasing gooey shreds of mozzarella, each bite-sized morsel offers a harmonious contrast between the creamy cheese center and the satisfyingly crunchy exterior. Served with a tantalizing chili oil and honey sauce, this appetizer presents a perfect balance of heat and sweetness that elevates the experience. A testament to comfort food innovation, these bites are a culinary adventure you won't want to miss.

directions.Direction: Begin by removing the drumettes from the chicken wing flats, creating a pocket for the stuffing. Carefully carve out the bones from the flats without piercing the skin.

Season the whole chicken with a rub of your choice, ensuring it's thoroughly coated. Cook the chicken until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C) using a cooking thermometer like the Thermopro Tempspike.

Prepare the buffalo sauce by combining hot sauce, melted butter, garlic powder, and onion powder in a pan over low heat. Mix the ingredients together until well combined. Set aside about 1/2 cup of the buffalo sauce for later use.
Shred the cooked chicken and mix it with the prepared buffalo sauce, leaving the reserved 1/2 cup aside. This will create a flavorful chicken mixture for stuffing.
Stuff the deboned chicken wing flats with the buffalo chicken mixture, ensuring they are filled evenly without overstuffing.
Set up a breading station with three separate bowls: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with bread crumbs.

Coat each stuffed chicken wing first in flour, shaking off any excess, then dip it into the beaten egg, allowing any excess to drip off, and finally, coat it with bread crumbs, pressing gently to adhere.

Heat oil in a frying pan or deep fryer to 375°F (190°C). Carefully place the breaded stuffed wings into the hot oil using tongs. Fry them for about 3-4 minutes, or until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Once the wings are fried, use tongs to carefully remove them from the oil and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any excess oil.
In a mixing bowl, toss the fried stuffed wings with the reserved buffalo sauce, ensuring they are evenly coated.
Serve the stuffed chicken wings hot and crispy, offering extra buffalo sauce on the side for dipping. Enjoy this delicious and creative twist on classic buffalo chicken!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Stuffed Chicken Wings
Description: Stuffed chicken wings are a delightful twist on the classic chicken wing, combining juicy shredded chicken with flavorful buffalo sauce, all encased in a crispy breaded shell. This unique dish is perfect for parties or as a special treat for yourself.

directions.Direction: For the Dough Recipe:
In a mixing bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups of warm water, 2 tablespoons of oil, and 3 tablespoons of yogurt.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder and gradually mix in 4 cups of flour until a smooth dough forms.
Knead the dough for a few minutes, then cover and let it rest for about 1 hour.
For the Butter Chicken Recipe:
Marinate 6-8 boneless chicken thighs in 1 tablespoon of ginger paste, 1 tablespoon of garlic paste, 1 tablespoon of chili powder, and salt to taste.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the marinated chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
Blend 4 Roma tomatoes, 1/2 white onion, 1 tablespoon of garlic paste, 1/2 cup of cashews, and 2 tablespoons of white vinegar until smooth.
In a pan, melt 5 tablespoons of butter and add the blended mixture. Cook for a few minutes.
Stir in 1/2 teaspoon of garam masala, 4 tablespoons of sugar, 2 tablespoons of chili powder, and salt to taste.
Add 3 tablespoons of cream and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
For the Balloon Assembly
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Divide the rested dough into 2 portions and roll each into a large circle.
Place one circle on a clean surface and spread a portion of the butter chicken over it, leaving a border around the edges.
Lay the second dough circle over the chicken-covered one. Press down the edges to seal, leaving a small hole unsealed.
Use a straw to blow air gently into the unsealed hole until the dough puffs up like a balloon.
Carefully brush the puffed dough with beaten egg for a shiny finish.
Place the stuffed dough on a baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the balloon is golden brown and cooked through.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Butter Chicken Naan Balloon
Description: The butter chicken, a rich and savory preparation of marinated chicken, blends harmoniously with the tomato-based sauce, enriched with cashews, cream, and aromatic spices. The stuffed naan balloon is brushed with egg for a lustrous finish before being baked to a golden crispness. As you slice into this culinary masterpiece, you'll experience the contrast of textures and the explosion of flavors from the tender butter chicken and the perfectly baked naan. Enjoy a symphony of taste and presentation that's sure to impress.

ingredients.Name: Cooking oil (for deep frying or air frying)

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl, combine buttermilk, salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne pepper (if using) to create a marinade.

Place the chicken thighs into a sealable plastic bag or a bowl. Pour the marinade over the chicken, ensuring all pieces are well-coated. Seal the bag or cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
While the chicken is marinating, take the bag of lightly buttered popcorn and roughly chop it to create popcorn pieces. Be cautious not to turn it into a fine powder.
Preheat your air fryer to 390°F (200°C).
Remove the marinated chicken from the fridge. Dip each chicken thigh into the chopped popcorn, pressing gently to adhere the popcorn coating to both sides of the chicken.
Place a sheet of parchment paper on the air fryer basket to prevent sticking. Lightly grease the parchment paper with cooking spray or oil.
Arrange the popcorn-coated chicken thighs in a single layer on the parchment paper in the air fryer basket, ensuring they don't touch each other.
Lightly spray the coated chicken with cooking spray to encourage crispiness.

Place the basket in the preheated air fryer and cook at 390°F (200°C) for about 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the coating is golden brown and crispy. You might need to flip the chicken halfway through for even cooking.
Once cooked, use kitchen tongs to carefully remove the chicken tenders from the air fryer basket.
Serve the popcorn-crusted chicken tenders with your favorite dipping sauces and sides.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Popcorn Crusted Chicken Tenders
Description: Indulge in a playful twist on traditional chicken tenders with our Popcorn Crusted Chicken Tenders recipe. Succulent chicken thighs are marinated in a flavorful blend of buttermilk and seasonings, infusing them with savory depth. After a relaxing stint in the fridge, the chicken is generously coated with chopped, buttery popcorn that adds a delightful crunch and a hint of nostalgia to every bite. Air frying these innovative tenders at a precise 390°F results in a golden, crispy exterior that encases the tender, juicy meat within. A creative blend of textures and flavors, these popcorn-crusted chicken tenders are a whimsical delight perfect for any gathering or a memorable family meal.

directions.Direction: For the Cannelloni Pasta:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the cannelloni pasta tubes and cook them according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta and set it aside.
For the Meatball Filling:
In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, dried parsley, minced garlic, grated Parmesan cheese, breadcrumbs, egg, salt, and pepper. Mix everything together thoroughly until well combined.
For the Pasta Tubes:

Carefully stuff each cannelloni pasta tube with the prepared meatball filling. Using a small spoon or your fingers, gently pack the meat mixture into the tubes. Be careful not to overstuff, as the pasta may burst during frying.
Take a wooden skewer and carefully pierce it through the length of each stuffed cannelloni tube. The skewer will hold the pasta together during frying and make it easier to handle.
Prepare three shallow bowls. In the first bowl, place all-purpose flour. In the second bowl, whisk the remaining egg. In the third bowl, add more breadcrumbs.
Roll each skewered stuffed pasta first in flour, then dip it in the beaten egg, and finally coat it with breadcrumbs, ensuring an even and thick coating.
In a deep skillet or frying pan, heat enough oil for frying over medium-high heat. Carefully add the coated pasta skewers to the hot oil.
Fry the meatball-stuffed pasta for about 8 minutes or until they turn golden brown and crispy on all sides.
Remove the pasta skewers from the oil and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
For the Marinara Dip:
While the pasta is frying, warm up the marinara sauce in a small saucepan over low heat.
Arrange the crispy Meatball-Stuffed Pasta on a Stick on a serving platter. Serve with the warm marinara sauce on the side for dipping.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Metball Stuffed Pasta on a Stick
Description: Meatball-Stuffed Pasta on a Stick is a delightful and innovative twist on traditional meatballs and pasta. Cannelloni pasta tubes are boiled to perfection and then generously stuffed with a flavorful mixture of ground beef, herbs, cheese, and breadcrumbs. The stuffed pasta is skewered with wooden sticks for easy handling and fun presentation. It's then coated with a crispy crust and lightly fried to golden brown perfection. Served with a side of rich marinara sauce for dipping, this dish will be a hit at any gathering or family dinner.

directions.Direction: Cut the chicken breasts into evenly sized strips or tenders.

Place the chicken strips in a bowl and pour enough pickle juice over them to fully submerge them. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for about an hour. The pickle juice brine will help tenderize the chicken and infuse it with flavor.
Open the Buldak Spicy Noodle packs and set aside the spicy sauce packets and crunchy topping packets.

Crush the dried noodles into smaller pieces, either by placing them in a plastic bag and gently crushing with a rolling pin or using your hands. Transfer the crushed noodles to a shallow bowl or plate.

In three separate bowls, prepare a dredging station. In the first bowl, place some all-purpose flour. In the second bowl, beat a couple of eggs with a splash of water to create an egg wash. Season the egg wash with a pinch of salt and pepper. In the third bowl, place the crushed noodles.
Remove the chicken strips from the pickle juice and pat them dry with paper towels.

Dredge each chicken strip in the flour, shaking off any excess. Dip it into the egg wash, allowing any excess to drip off, and then coat it thoroughly in the crushed noodles. Press the noodles onto the chicken to ensure they adhere well.
In a deep skillet or frying pan, heat frying oil to 375°F (190°C).
Carefully place the coated chicken strips into the hot oil, ensuring not to overcrowd the pan. Fry in batches if necessary.

Fry the chicken for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the coating is golden brown and the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F (74°C). Use a kitchen thermometer to check the temperature.
While the chicken is frying, mix a couple of spoonfuls of the hot oil from the pan with the spicy sauce packets that came with the Buldak Spicy Noodles. Stir well to combine.
Once the chicken tenders are cooked and crispy, remove them from the oil and let them drain on a paper towel-lined plate briefly.
Toss the fried chicken tenders in the prepared spicy sauce, ensuring they are evenly coated.
Sprinkle the crunchy topping packet over the sauced chicken tenders. This will add an extra layer of flavor and texture.
Serve the Fire Noodle Chicken Tenders while they're still hot and crispy, alongside your favorite dipping sauce or a cooling side.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Fire Noodle Chicken Tenders
Description: Spice up your chicken tender game with this fiery twist on a classic favorite. These Fire Noodle Chicken Tenders are a fusion of crispy chicken tenders and the bold flavors of Buldak Spicy Noodles. The crispy, golden-brown tenders are coated in a mouthwatering blend of spicy noodle sauce and topped with a crunchy seasoning, creating a delightful explosion of flavors and textures. Whether you're a fan of heat or just looking to try something new, these chicken tenders will definitely make your taste buds tingle.

ingredients.Name: Large Pig Skin, about 6x6 cut into strips

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C) to ensure it's ready for baking.

Lay out the chicharrón pieces on a clean, dry surface. They should be pliable enough to wrap around the cannoli tubes. If they're too stiff, you can gently warm them in the microwave for a few seconds to soften them.

Take a chicharrón piece and wrap it around a cannoli tube, starting at one end and spiraling towards the other. Press gently to adhere the chicharrón to itself. Repeat this process for all cannoli tubes.

Place the chicharrón-wrapped cannoli tubes on a baking sheet, making sure they are secure and won't unravel during baking. Bake in the preheated oven for about 90 minutes or until the chicharrón is golden brown and crispy. Keep an eye on them to prevent over-browning.
Once the chicharrón wraps are crispy and ready, carefully remove them from the cannoli tubes. They should hold their shape nicely.
Insert a cooked hot dog into each chicharrón wrap. Add to a hot dog bun. The chicharrón will create a flavorful and crispy casing around the hot dog.
Drizzle ketchup and mustard over each chicharrón-wrapped hot dog, according to your preference. For an extra kick, spoon a generous amount of spicy relish on top.
Sprinkle finely chopped fresh chives over the condiments. The chives add a touch of freshness and balance out the flavors.
The combination of textures and flavors is sure to delight your taste buds.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Chicharron Glizzy
Description: Indulge in a unique and flavorful culinary adventure with our Chicharrón-Wrapped Hot Dog recipe. Crispy chicharrón (pig skin) embraces a juicy hot dog, creating a tantalizing contrast of textures and a fusion of delicious tastes. The hot dog is elevated with a trio of condiments: tangy ketchup, zesty mustard, and fiery spicy relish. A sprinkle of fresh chives adds a touch of herbaceous elegance to this delectable treat. Perfect for gatherings or when you're craving an innovative twist on a classic favorite.

ingredients.Name: large shrimp, peeled, deveined, and diced into a paste
chicken skin pieces (reserved from chicken thighs)

directions.Direction: Pull the skin directly off each chicken thigh. Using a sharp knife cut the chicken into a square.
Dice the shrimp into a paste-like texture then add and combine spices (salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chili powder) and egg yolk
In a shallow bowl, beat the egg and set aside.

Take a spoonful of the diced shrimp mixture and wrap it with a piece of chicken skin. Ensure the chicken skin covers the shrimp completely. Secure with a toothpick if necessary. Repeat the process for all the shrimp pieces.
Dip the coated shrimp into the egg wash, making sure it is fully coated with the egg mixture.
In a separate shallow bowl, place the potato starch. Dip each wrapped shrimp into the potato starch, ensuring an even coating on all sides.
In a deep frying pan or pot, heat enough vegetable oil to deep-fry the shrimp wraps. Heat the oil to 175°C (175°C).

Carefully place the coated shrimp wraps into the hot oil, in batches if necessary. Fry for 3-4 minutes or until the chicken skin is golden and crispy, and the shrimp is cooked through. Remove with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil.

Arrange the fried shrimp wraps on a serving platter. Drizzle the warm BBQ sauce over the top or serve it as a dipping sauce on the side. Optionally, you can garnish with some fresh chopped parsley or spring onions for added color and flavor.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Chicken Skin Wrapped Shrimp
Description: Get ready to indulge in a mouthwatering dish that combines the succulence of shrimp, the crispy goodness of chicken skin, and the rich flavors of BBQ sauce. This recipe for Chicken Skin Wrapped Shrimp Bombs is a true delight that will impress your guests and satisfy your taste buds. The combination of tender shrimp, crispy chicken skin, and the delectable sweet and smoky BBQ sauce will make this dish a favorite at any gathering or dinner table.

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove the salmon skin and lay the salmon skin strips flat and pat them dry with a paper towel to remove excess moisture.
Place the salmon skin strips between two metal taco shell holders to hold their shape while baking. This will help them become crispy and taco shell-like.
Place the metal taco shell holders with the salmon skin strips in the preheated oven.
Bake for about 10-15 minutes or until the skin becomes crispy and golden brown. Keep an eye on them to avoid burning.

In a bowl, combine the diced raw salmon, finely chopped green onions, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and a pinch of salt. Gently mix to evenly distribute the flavors. Set aside to marinate for a few minutes.
Take a crispy salmon skin taco shell and fill it with a layer of cooked rice.
Spoon the marinated salmon mixture on top of the rice, distributing it evenly among the taco shells.
Drizzle a generous amount of spicy mayonnaise over the salmon mixture. Adjust the amount according to your spice preference.
Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds over the tacos for a nutty and aromatic crunch.
Carefully transfer the assembled tacos to a serving platter.
Serve the crispy salmon skin tacos immediately, allowing everyone to enjoy the blend of flavors and textures.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Salmon Skin Taco Shells
Description: These Crispy Salmon Skin Tacos are a delightful fusion of flavors and textures. The star of the show is the perfectly crispy salmon skin, which adds a satisfying crunch to each bite. The combination of tender raw salmon, zesty green onions, umami-rich soy sauce, tangy vinegar, and a hint of salt creates a balanced and mouthwatering filling. Assembling the tacos with fluffy rice, the flavorful salmon mixture, a kick of spicy mayonnaise, and a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds results in a culinary masterpiece that's as visually appealing as it is delicious.

directions.Direction: For the Steak:
Generously season the skirt steak with salt and pepper on both sides.
Preheat the grill to high heat.
Drizzle olive oil over the steak and place it on the hot grill. Cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side or until your desired level of doneness.
Remove the steak from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes. Once rested, wrap it in aluminum foil and chop it into small, bite-sized pieces. Set aside.
For the Filling:
In a medium heat pan, add a bit of olive oil.
Add the finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Stir in the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the diced tomatoes and cook for another 3-4 minutes until the mixture is well combined and slightly thickened.
Transfer the onion-tomato mixture to a bowl and combine it with the chopped grilled steak. Mix well and set aside.
For the Jalapeño Boats:
Cut each jalapeño in half lengthwise and carefully remove the seeds and membranes from the center, creating "boats."
In a shallow dish, combine the all-purpose flour, chili powder, cumin, paprika, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
In another shallow dish, place the beaten eggs.
Dredge each jalapeño boat in the flour mixture, making sure to coat it evenly. Dip it into the beaten eggs, allowing any excess to drip off, and then dredge it again in the flour mixture.
In a deep skillet or pot, heat vegetable oil to around 350°F (175°C).
Carefully place the coated jalapeño boats in the hot oil, a few at a time, and fry until they turn golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes.
Use a slotted spoon to transfer the fried jalapeño boats to a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
Fill each fried jalapeño boat with the steak and tomato mixture, pressing it gently to fill the cavity.
Arrange the filled jalapeño boats on a serving platter.
These Jalapeño Boats Filled with Steak are best served warm. They make a fantastic appetizer or snack for a spicy food lover!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Jalapeno Boats
Description: Indulge in a spicy and savory delight with these Jalapeño Boats filled with seasoned steak. Tender skirt steak is grilled to perfection, combined with a medley of browned onions, garlic, and diced tomatoes, creating a flavorful mixture. The steak mixture is then nestled into jalapeño boats, which are coated in a crispy, golden-brown shell. This dish offers a harmonious blend of textures and flavors that will surely satisfy your taste buds.

ingredients.Name: shredded mozzarella cheese (or your preferred cheese)

directions.Direction: Preheat a skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat and add enough vegetable oil to shallow fry the chicken.
Butterfly the chicken breasts by cutting them horizontally, then place them in a plastic bag and gently pound them to an even thickness.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Dip each chicken breast into the beaten eggs, allowing any excess to drip off.
Coat the chicken breasts in the Italian breadcrumbs, pressing gently to adhere the breadcrumbs to the chicken.

Carefully place the breaded chicken breasts in the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides. This usually takes about 3-4 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the chicken. Once cooked, transfer them to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
Lay out a large flour tortilla on a clean surface.
Spread a spoonful of marinara sauce in the center of the tortilla, leaving a border around the edges.
Sprinkle a portion of shredded cheese over the sauce.
Place one cooked chicken breast on top of the cheese.
Top the chicken with another spoonful of marinara sauce and more shredded cheese
Take a smaller flour tortilla and place it on top of the cheese.
Carefully fold the edges of the large tortilla over the fillings, creating an octagon-like shape.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and place the crunch wrap, seam side down, onto the skillet.
Cook until the bottom is golden brown and crispy, then carefully flip it over and cook the other side until golden brown as well.
For the Garlic Butter Finish:
In a small pan, melt the butter and add the minced garlic. Cook for about a minute until the garlic is fragrant.
Brush the top of the cooked crunch wrap with the garlic butter mixture.
Slice the Chicken Parmesan Crunch Wrap into halves or quarters and serve hot.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Garlic Parm Crunch Wrap
Description: The Chicken Parmesan Crunch Wrap takes the classic flavors of Chicken Parmesan and combines them with the convenience of a handheld wrap. Juicy butterfly chicken breasts are coated in a crispy layer of Italian breadcrumbs, then layered with marinara sauce and cheese inside a large flour tortilla. The wrap is folded and pan-fried until golden and crispy, then brushed with garlic butter for an extra layer of flavor. This dish offers a delightful fusion of textures and tastes, making it a perfect option for a satisfying meal.

ingredients.Name: large shrimp, peeled and deveined, tails intact
of filo dough, thawed if frozen

directions.Direction: Start by straightening the shrimp. Gently remove the peel and devein to ensure they lay flat.
Season the shrimp with a sprinkle of salt and pepper.
Take a wooden skewer that has been soaked in water to prevent burning. Thread each shrimp onto a skewer lengthwise.
Lay out a flattened sheet of shredded filo dough.
Place the skewered shrimp at one end of the filo strips and roll it up tightly, like a cigar, ensuring the shrimp is enclosed in the dough. Repeat for each shrimp.
In a deep pan or pot, heat vegetable oil to around 350°F (175°C).

Gently slide each wrapped shrimp into the hot oil, seam side down, and fry for 2-3 minutes or until the filo dough turns golden brown and crispy. Be cautious not to overcrowd the pan – fry in batches if needed.
Use tongs to carefully remove the fried shrimp from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
Serve the tornado shrimp skewers on a platter with a dipping sauce of your choice. Some options include sweet chili sauce, garlic aioli, or a tangy cocktail sauce.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Tornado Shrimp
Description: Tornado Shrimp is a delightful appetizer that combines succulent shrimp with the crispiness of shredded filo dough. The skewered shrimp are coated with thin layers of filo dough, creating a visually striking tornado-like presentation. These golden brown and crispy shrimp tornadoes are not only a treat for the taste buds but also an eye-catching addition to any gathering.

ingredients.Name: pancake, cooked and mashed into crumbles

directions.Direction: In a skillet over medium heat, cook the breakfast sausage until it's browned and cooked through. Break it up into crumbles using a spatula while cooking. Once cooked, remove from the heat and set aside.
Place the eggs in a single layer in a saucepan and cover them with water.
Place the saucepan over high heat and bring the water to a boil.
Once boiling, reduce the heat slightly to maintain a gentle boil, and cook the eggs for about 10-12 minutes.
Remove the saucepan from the heat and transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water to cool for a few minutes.
Gently tap the cooled eggs on a hard surface to crack the shells, then peel them under running water.
Slice each egg in half lengthwise. Carefully remove the yolks and place them in a separate bowl.
Mash the egg yolks with a fork until they are smooth and crumbly.
Add the paprika, black pepper, salt, mayonnaise, and crumbled breakfast sausage to the mashed yolks.
Mix all the ingredients together until well combined and creamy. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Using a spoon or a piping bag, fill each egg white half with the deviled egg mixture. You can also use a plastic bag with a corner snipped off as a makeshift piping bag.
Prepare a pancake according to your favorite pancake recipe. As the pancake cooks mash it into crumbles using a spatula.
Sprinkle the crumbled pancake on top of each deviled egg.
Add a small slice of bacon.
Just before serving, drizzle a small amount of pancake syrup over the top of each deviled egg. The sweetness will complement the savory flavors.
These unique deviled eggs are now ready to be enjoyed. The combination of flavors will surprise and delight your taste buds.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Breakfast Deviled Eggs
Description: Elevate your brunch game with these delightful Pancake Breakfast Deviled Eggs. Combining the classic deviled egg with the comforting flavors of a pancake breakfast, this dish offers a playful twist that's sure to impress your guests. Creamy deviled egg filling gets a flavor boost from breakfast sausage, pancake crumble, and the touch of pancake syrup and crispy bacon on top creates a perfect balance of sweet and savory.

directions.Direction: In a bowl, pour buttermilk over the frog legs.
Sprinkle 1-2 tablespoons of creole seasoning over the frog legs.
Mix well to ensure the legs are evenly coated in buttermilk and seasoning.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, allowing the flavors to infuse.
In a shallow dish, combine the all-purpose flour, breadcrumbs, and the remaining 1-2 tablespoon of creole seasoning.
Mix the dredge ingredients thoroughly to evenly distribute the seasoning.
Remove the marinated frog legs from the refrigerator.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet or frying pan to around 350°F (175°C).
Take each frog leg from the buttermilk mixture and let any excess liquid drip off.
Roll the frog legs in the prepared dredge mixture, pressing gently to ensure the coating adheres well.
Carefully place the coated frog legs in the hot oil, being cautious not to overcrowd the pan.
Fry the legs for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they turn a golden brown color and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Use a slotted spoon to remove the fried frog legs from the oil and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
For the Creole Butter Dip:
In a small bowl, combine the melted butter, creole seasoning, hot sauce, and lemon juice.
Stir well to create a smooth and well-mixed dip.
Serve the frog legs alongside the flavorful creole butter dip.
Dip the breaded frog legs into the creole butter sauce before taking a bite, allowing the flavors to meld and enhance the experience.
Savor the combination of crispy coating, tender meat, and the deliciously seasoned butter dip.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Creole Frog Legs
Description: Controversial opinion frog legs are better than chicken wings. Delight your taste buds with this unique and flavorful dish of breaded frog legs. The frog legs are marinated in a zesty buttermilk and creole seasoning mixture, creating a tender and seasoned base. They are then coated in a crispy dredge made from flour, breadcrumbs, and more creole seasoning, delivering a satisfying crunch in every bite. After a quick fry until golden brown and fully cooked, these succulent frog legs are ready to be dipped into a rich and savory creole butter sauce, adding an extra layer of indulgence to the dish. Prepare this recipe for a memorable and adventurous dining experience.

directions.Direction: For the Brine:
In a large pot, combine the water, mustard seeds, peppercorns, cloves, juniper berries, onion, celery, carrots, pink curing salt, and regular salt.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then let it simmer for about 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Remove the pot from the heat and add the cinnamon stick. Let the brine cool to room temperature.
For the Brisket:
Place the brisket flat in a large container or a resealable plastic bag.
Pour the cooled brine mixture over the brisket, ensuring it's completely submerged.
If using a bag, seal it well, removing as much air as possible. If using a container, you can place a heavy plate on top of the brisket to keep it submerged.
Place the container or bag in the refrigerator and let the brisket marinate in the brine for 14 days. Turn the brisket occasionally to ensure even curing.
For the Corned Beef:
After the 14-day curing period, preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
Remove the brisket from the brine and rinse it thoroughly under cold water to remove excess salt. Pat it dry with paper towels.
Season generously with paprika and cayenne.
Place the rinsed brisket on a roasting rack inside a baking dish.
Cover the baking dish tightly with aluminum foil to ensure the meat retains moisture during cooking.
Bake the brisket in the preheated oven for about 3 hours, or until it becomes fork-tender.
Once the corned beef is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing.
Slice the corned beef against the grain into thin slices for the best texture and tenderness.
Serve your homemade corned beef slices with your favorite sides, such as boiled cabbage, potatoes, and mustard sauce.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Irish Corned Beef
Description: Indulge in the rich flavors of homemade corned beef with this easy-to-follow recipe. The brisket is marinated for 14 days in a flavorful blend of spices and seasonings, resulting in tender, succulent meat that's perfect for any occasion. After the curing process, the corned beef is slow-baked to perfection, making it a delightful centerpiece for your meals.

ingredients.Name: large piece of pig skin (about 1 pound)

directions.Direction: Start by thoroughly cleaning the pig skin to remove any excess fat or debris. Pat it dry with paper towels. Cut into your preferred pizza shape.
Rub salt evenly all over the pig skin, making sure to coat it thoroughly.
Place the salted pig skin on a wire rack and refrigerate overnight to allow the salt to draw out moisture.
Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C).
Remove the pig skin from the refrigerator and remove the excess salt. Place the pig skin between two baking trays to help keep it flat during baking.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 to 1.5 hours, or until the pig skin is golden brown and crispy. Check on it occasionally to prevent burning.
Once baked, remove it from the oven and let it cool.
Spread the marinara sauce evenly over the pig skin crust, leaving a small border around the edges for the "crust."
Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Arrange the sliced pepperoni, and your choice of toppings on the cheese.
Carefully transfer the assembled pizza to a baking sheet or pizza stone.
Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the toppings are cooked to your liking.
Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a minute.
Slice the Chicharrón Pizza into wedges and serve immediately, savoring the unique combination of flavors and textures.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Chicharron Crust Pizza
Description: Indulge in a unique culinary adventure with our Chicharrón Pizza featuring a crispy pig skin crust that's both crunchy and flavorful. This innovative recipe takes traditional pizza to a whole new level, combining the bold taste of chicharrón (fried pork skin) with classic pizza toppings. Salting the pig skin overnight ensures the perfect balance of crispiness and seasoning. The result is a mouthwatering pizza that's sure to impress your taste buds.

directions.Direction: For the Garlic Oil

Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C). Place the peeled garlic cloves in a small oven-safe dish and cover them with olive oil. Bake in the preheated oven for 2 hours until the garlic becomes soft and fragrant. Remove from the oven and set aside.
For the Pork Tenderloin:

While the garlic is roasting, prepare the pork tenderloin. Pat the tenderloin dry with paper towels and season it with salt. In a hot skillet over medium-high heat, sear the tenderloin on all sides until it forms a nice golden crust. Remove from the heat and let it cool slightly.

Once the tenderloin has cooled a bit, brush the grainy mustard all over the surface. In a small bowl, combine the chopped sage and rosemary. Roll the mustard-covered tenderloin in the herb mixture until it's coated evenly.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut out the center of the baguette to create a cavity that's roughly the same size as the tenderloin. Reserve the removed bread for another use.

Retrieve the roasted garlic cloves and the garlic-infused oil. Use a fork to mash the roasted garlic cloves in a bowl, then mix them with a tablespoon or two of the garlic-infused oil to create a garlic spread.
Brush the inside of the baguette with the garlic-infused oil, then spread the mashed garlic evenly along the inside.
Gently place the seasoned and herbed tenderloin inside the prepared baguette. Use butcher's twine to secure the stuffed baguette, tying it at intervals to ensure the pork remains enclosed.
Place the stuffed baguette on a baking sheet or in a baking dish, and bake for about 25 minutes until the pork reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C) and is cooked through.

Once done, let the Garlic Tuscan Pork Tenderloin rest for a few minutes before slicing it into rounds. The aromatic herb crust and the roasted garlic-infused bread will complement the tender and juicy pork. Serve with your choice of sides, such as roasted vegetables, salads, or creamy mashed potatoes, for a complete and satisfying meal.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Garlic Tuscan Pork Tenderloin
Description: Indulge in the rich flavors of Tuscany with this Garlic Tuscan Pork Tenderloin recipe. Succulent pork tenderloin is elevated with aromatic garlic, fragrant herbs, and a crusty baguette for a delightful dining experience. This dish combines the warmth of slow-roasted garlic with the hearty essence of pork, creating a fusion of flavors that will transport your taste buds to the heart of Italy.

ingredients.Name: bacon fat (rendered from the cooked bacon)

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Lay out each strip of bacon individually on the baking sheet.
Cover the bacon with another sheet of parchment paper and place another baking sheet on top. This prevents the bacon from curling while it cooks.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the fat has rendered out.
Once cooked, remove the bacon from the oven and let it cool slightly.
Finely chop the cooked crispy bacon and set it aside.
Carefully collect the rendered bacon fat from the baking sheet, straining out any solids.
Measure out 1 cup of the rendered bacon fat and allow it to cool slightly.
In a medium-sized bowl, combine the egg yolks, Dijon mustard, and fresh lemon juice. Whisk together until well combined and slightly creamy.
Slowly drizzle in the cooled bacon fat while continuously whisking. This will help create an emulsified mixture. Make sure to add the fat gradually to avoid curdling the yolks.
Continue whisking as you slowly pour in the bacon fat. The mixture should thicken and become smooth as the fat incorporates into the yolks.
Season the Baconnaise with a pinch of salt and a dash of freshly ground black pepper. Adjust the seasoning according to your taste preferences.
Add the finely chopped crispy bacon to the emulsified mixture. Mix it in thoroughly to evenly distribute the bacon bits.
Gently fold in the finely chopped fresh parsley. The parsley adds a burst of color and freshness to the Baconnaise.
Transfer the Baconnaise to a clean jar or airtight container.
Refrigerate for at least an hour before using, as this will allow the flavors to meld together.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Baconnaise
Description: Baconnaise is a rich and flavorful condiment that combines the smokiness of crispy bacon with the creamy goodness of mayonnaise. This recipe takes bacon to a whole new level by infusing its essence into a homemade mayonnaise base. Perfect as a dip, spread, or topping, this Baconnaise will add a delightful twist to your sandwiches, burgers, and appetizers.

ingredients.Name: For the Pig Skin Taco Shells:
large piece of pig skin (about 1 pound)
small pineapple, peeled and sliced into rings

directions.Direction: For the Pig Skin Taco Shells:
Start by cleaning the pig skin and removing any excess fat.
Generously coat the pig skin with salt on both sides.
Place the salted pig skin on a plate or tray and leave it uncovered in the refrigerator overnight. This step will help to dry out the skin.
Preheat your oven to 325°F.
Place two metal taco shell holders on a baking sheet.
Carefully lay the prepared pig skin over the taco shell holders, draping the skin to create the taco shell shape.
Bake the pig skin in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the skin becomes crispy and holds its shape.
Remove the taco shell from the oven and let it cool slightly before handling.
For the Pico de Gallo and Pineapple
In a bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, chopped onion, cilantro, minced jalapeno, and lime juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to use.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium heat.
Grill the pineapple rings for about 2-3 minutes on each side, until they develop grill marks and caramelize slightly. Remove from heat and set aside.
Brush the pineapple rings with a little olive oil to prevent sticking.
For the Assembly
Fill each pig skin taco shell with a generous portion of pulled pork.
Top with pico de gallo and grilled pineapple slices.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Chicharron Taco Shells
Description: Indulge in the ultimate fusion of flavors and textures with these Crispy Pig Skin Taco Shells. The pig skin is carefully prepared, baked to perfection, and transformed into a crunchy shell that holds a delicious filling of tender pulled pork, vibrant pico de gallo, and sweet grilled pineapple. This creative twist on traditional tacos will leave your taste buds amazed and satisfied.

directions.Direction: Pat the chicken thighs dry with paper towels.
Sprinkle lemon pepper seasoning on both sides of the chicken thighs, pressing the seasoning gently into the meat.
In a large skillet or pan, heat the cooking oil over medium-high heat.
Place the seasoned chicken thighs in the pan and cook for about 5-6 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and fully cooked.
Once cooked, remove the chicken from the pan and set it aside on a plate.
In the same pan, add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in the chicken broth and add the orzo pasta. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
Gently place the cooked chicken thighs back into the pan on top of the orzo mixture.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low.
Cover the pan with a lid and let the dish simmer for about 10-12 minutes, or until the orzo is tender and has absorbed most of the liquid. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Once the orzo is cooked to your desired consistency and has absorbed most of the liquid, remove the pan from the heat.
Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese evenly over the top of the orzo and chicken.
Cover the pan again and let it sit for a few minutes to allow the feta cheese to slightly melt.
Finally, garnish with chopped parsley for a pop of color and freshness.
Serve the One Pan Orzo Lemon Pepper Chicken warm directly from the skillet.
Make sure to get a little bit of everything in each bite – the succulent chicken, flavorful orzo, creamy feta cheese, and the aromatic parsley.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: One Pan Lemon Pepper Chicken
Description: Enjoy a burst of flavors with this delightful one-pan dish! Tender chicken thighs are seasoned to perfection with zesty lemon pepper, then combined with orzo pasta, creating a harmonious blend of textures and tastes. The dish is elevated with the creamy tang of feta cheese and the freshness of parsley, resulting in a satisfying meal that's both easy to prepare and a treat for your taste buds.

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or lightly grease it.
Lay out two slices of white bread.
On one slice, spread a layer of pizza sauce.
Top the sauce with shredded mozzarella cheese.
Place a few slices of pepperoni on top of the cheese.
Cover with another slice of bread to create a sandwich.

Use a bowl or a cup with a round opening slightly larger than your desired pizza disc size to cut out a circle from the sandwich. Press down firmly to seal the edges. Repeat with the remaining sandwiches.
In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and chopped parsley to the melted butter.
Whisk the mixture well and let it cook for about 1-2 minutes until the garlic becomes fragrant. Remove from heat.
Using a pastry brush, generously paint both sides of each bread circle with the garlic and parsley mixture. Ensure they are well coated.
Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on both sides of the bread circles, pressing it gently to adhere.
Place the coated pizza discs on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes or until the pizza discs turn golden brown and crispy.
Remove the pizza discs from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving.
These Garlic Parm Pizza Discs can be enjoyed on their own as a snack or appetizer, or paired with a side salad for a light meal.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Garlic-Parm Pizza Discs
Description: Garlic Parm Pizza Discs are a delightful and creative twist on traditional pizza. These delicious treats are made by sandwiching mozzarella, pizza sauce, and pepperoni between slices of white bread, cutting them into circles, and then baking them with a buttery garlic and parsley mixture, all finished off with a generous sprinkle of Parmesan cheese. The result is a crispy, flavorful, and cheesy snack that's perfect for a quick meal or a fun appetizer.

directions.Direction: For the Burger Filling
Add chopped onions to the skillet and cook until they are translucent, fragrant, and start to brown. Set aside.
In a skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat until just almost completely cooked.
Add the onions to the ground beef and continue to cook. Turn off the heat and mix in the American cheese slices until melted. Set aside.
For the Balloon Dough
In a mixing bowl, combine the plain yogurt, water, and baking powder. Mix well.
Gradually add the all-purpose flour, mixing as you go, until a firm dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead it until smooth and elastic.
Divide the dough into small balls, about the size of a tennis ball.
Roll each ball into a thin circle, about 8-10 inches in diameter.
For the Big Mac Balloon
Place a portion of the beef mixture onto the middle of the dough circle.
Sprinkle chopped pickles over the beef mixture, and drizzle with Big Mac sauce.
Cover the dough ground beef dough circle with another piece of dough.
Use your fingers to crimp and seal the edges, leaving a small opening for a straw.
Preheat the oven to 385°F.
Gently insert a small straw through the opening in the dough, and blow air into the "balloon" until it puffs up slightly.
Remove the straw and seal the opening completely.
Brush the surface of the dough with the egg yolk for a golden finish.
Place the filled and "inflated" dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Sprinkle sesame seeds over the top of the dough.
Bake the Big Mac Balloons in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
Allow the Big Mac Balloons to cool slightly before serving.
To enjoy, simply tear into the crispy crust and savor the flavorful combination of beef, cheese, pickles, and sauce.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Big Mac Balloon
Description: The Big Mac Balloon is a whimsical twist on the classic fast-food favorite, the Big Mac. Imagine a handheld, savory balloon filled with all the delicious elements of a Big Mac sandwich, encased in a light and fluffy "balloon dough." This creative recipe combines the flavors of juicy ground beef, tangy American cheese, crisp onions, zesty pickles, and the iconic Big Mac sauce, all wrapped in a golden-brown, sesame-studded crust. The highlight of this culinary experience is the interactive aspect – blowing air into a small straw to "inflate" the balloon before devouring its flavorful contents.

directions.Direction: For the Sweet Cream Layer:
In a mixing bowl, combine the heavy cream and powdered sugar.
Using a whisk or an electric mixer, vigorously whip the cream and sugar until soft peaks form. Set aside.
For the Butterscotch Mixture:
In a microwave-safe bowl, heat the butterscotch syrup and unsalted butter together until the butter is melted. This can also be done on the stovetop over low heat.
Stir the mixture well to ensure the butterscotch syrup and butter are fully combined. Allow it to cool slightly.
For the Assemble the Butterbeer:
Take your serving glasses and pour the butterscotch mixture into each glass, distributing it evenly among them. The butterscotch mixture will settle at the bottom of the glass.
Open the bottle of cream soda and pour it slowly into each glass, over the butterscotch mixture. Leave a little space at the top to accommodate the sweet cream layer.
Gently spoon or pipe the prepared sweet cream over the top of each glass, creating a frothy and creamy layer.
For an extra touch of authenticity, you can serve your Butterbeer with a colorful paper straw or even a drizzle of extra butterscotch syrup on top.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Butter Beer
Description: Transport yourself to the magical world of wizards and witches with this delightful Butterbeer recipe. A creamy concoction that combines the rich flavors of butterscotch and cream soda, topped with a luscious sweet cream layer. Perfect for a cozy evening or a themed party, this Butterbeer will make you feel like you're right at the Three Broomsticks.

ingredients.Name: Puff quinoa (enough to coat the corn dogs)

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the corn flour, white flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt until well combined.
In another bowl, combine buttermilk, oil, and egg. Whisk until combined.
Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until a sticky dough forms. Make sure there are no large lumps.
Chop your hot dogs into quarters and your mozzarella into similar size cubes.

Insert the skewer through the center of the hotdog lengthwise. Then, thread a chunk of mozzarella onto the skewer, followed by another hotdog chunk, and continue alternating until you have used a full hotdog.
Dip the hotdog skewer into the sticky batter, making sure it's evenly coated on all sides.
Roll the coated hotdog in puff quinoa, pressing gently to adhere the quinoa to the batter.
Heat oil in a deep pot or fryer to 375°F (190°C).
Carefully place the coated hotdog into the hot oil and fry for about 4-5 minutes, or until the batter is golden brown and crispy. You can fry one or two at a time, depending on the size of your pot.
Once fried, use tongs to remove the corn dog from the oil, allowing any excess oil to drip off.
While still warm, sprinkle a little sugar over the fried corn dog. The sugar will cling to the surface and provide a delightful sweet contrast.
Repeat the process for the remaining hotdogs.
Serve the Korean corn dogs while they're still hot and the cheese is gooey.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Korean Corn Dog
Description: Indulge in the irresistible Korean Corn Dogs, a delightful fusion of sweet and savory flavors. These mouthwatering treats feature a juicy hotdog and gooey mozzarella, encased in a crispy cornmeal batter, rolled in puff quinoa for extra crunchiness, and fried to golden perfection. A final sprinkle of sugar adds a touch of sweetness that perfectly complements the savory core. These corn dogs are a popular street food in Korea and will surely become a favorite in your household as well.

directions.Direction: Carefully separate the egg yolks from the egg whites, ensuring no traces of egg whites remain on the yolks. This is crucial to achieve the desired texture.
Choose a hot sauce that aligns with your heat tolerance and flavor preference. Whether you opt for a smoky chipotle sauce or a blazing habanero blend, the choice is yours.
In a large container with a lid, pour enough hot sauce to completely submerge the egg yolks. The hot sauce will not only infuse a fiery kick but also act as a preservative during the curing process.

Seal the container with the lid and place it in the refrigerator. Allow the egg yolks to cure for about a week. During this time, the yolks will undergo a transformation, becoming firmer in texture while retaining a jam-like consistency.
After the week is up, carefully remove the cured egg yolks from the hot sauce. You'll notice a vibrant hue and a tantalizing aroma that signals their readiness.

Enjoy the hot sauce-cured egg yolks by spreading them over your chosen accompaniment. The yolks' creamy, jam-like texture will melt in your mouth, while the hot sauce imparts a flavorful and spicy punch.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Hot Sauce Cured Egg Yolks
Description: Indulge in a culinary adventure with these exquisite hot sauce-cured egg yolks. A unique blend of fiery heat and creamy richness awaits in every bite. Reminiscent of a luscious jam, these egg yolks undergo a week-long transformation in a bath of tangy and spicy hot sauce. The result? Yolks that are delightfully firm, yet possess a jam-like texture that spreads smoothly over your favorite crackers or bread. This unconventional delicacy is a guaranteed conversation starter for your next gathering.

ingredients.Name: large block of cream cheese, softened

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Take the loaf of white bread and spread a generous amount of softened cream cheese onto the center of half of the pieces. Lay the cream cheese-covered half of the bread slices on a clean surface.
Place another slice of bread on top of each cream cheese-covered slice, creating a sandwich with cream cheese in the center.
Use a small bowl or a seal and edging tool to cut the edges of the bread off, forming neat, round discs. Press the edges firmly to seal the cream cheese inside.

In a saucepan, melt the 2 sticks of butter over low heat. Once melted, add the milk, chopped garlic, and chopped parsley. Stir the mixture together and let it warm up. Be careful not to let it get too hot to avoid cooking the egg in the next step.
Gradually pour the egg mixture into the warm garlic mixture while whisking constantly. Continue whisking until the mixture is well combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Dip each cream cheese disc into the garlic mixture, making sure to coat both sides thoroughly.
Place the coated discs on the prepared baking sheet, leaving a bit of space between them.
Bake the garlic bread cream cheese discs in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Once baked, remove the discs from the oven and dip them again into the garlic mixture for an extra burst of flavor.
Serve the Garlic Bread Cream Cheese Discs warm and enjoy their gooey creaminess and delightful garlic-infused taste.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Garlic Bread Cream Cheese Discs
Description: Garlic Bread Cream Cheese Discs are a delicious and indulgent treat that combines the rich creaminess of cream cheese with the aromatic flavors of garlic and parsley. This recipe takes regular white bread slices, sandwiches a generous amount of cream cheese between them, and then transforms them into crispy, flavorful discs by dipping them into a buttery garlic mixture and baking them to perfection.

ingredients.Name: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut half lengthwise
hot sauce (adjust to your desired level of spiciness)
garlic buffalo seasoning rub (or your favorite seasoning blend)

directions.Direction: In a bowl, mix buttermilk, hot sauce, and garlic buffalo seasoning rub. Submerge the chicken pieces in the buttermilk mixture, ensuring they are fully coated. Cover the bowl and place it in the fridge to marinate for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight for the best flavor.
Prepare the dredge by placing the flour and additional seasoning in a shallow dish. Mix well to combine.

Remove the chicken from the buttermilk marinade and let any excess liquid drip off. Coat each piece of chicken in the seasoned flour, pressing the flour mixture onto the chicken to create a nice coating.
In a deep, heavy-bottomed pot or skillet, heat enough vegetable oil to submerge the chicken pieces. Heat the oil to 350°F (175°C) over medium heat.

Carefully place the coated chicken into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per side. Ensure the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F (74°C) for safe consumption.
While the chicken is frying, prepare the sauce by combining mayonnaise, garlic powder, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, and black pepper in a small bowl. Mix until smooth and well combined.
Once the chicken is cooked, transfer it to a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.

For the bread, cut the fresh loaf into 3-4 inch chunks. Slice each chunk down the middle without cutting the bread in half entirely. Toast each side of the bread until a light crust forms, either on a griddle or in a toaster.
Assemble the fried chicken sandwiches by placing a crispy chicken piece on the bottom half of each toasted bread chunk. Top with sliced pickles.
Generously coat the chicken with the prepared sauce, and if desired, add an additional drizzle of hot sauce for extra spiciness.
Serve the crispy fried chicken sandwiches immediately, and enjoy!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Jorts Fried Chicken
Description:
The Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich is a mouthwatering delight that takes the classic fried chicken to a whole new level. Tender and juicy chicken breast halves are marinated in a tangy buttermilk and hot sauce mixture, infused with the bold flavors of garlic buffalo seasoning. Coated in a perfectly seasoned flour dredge, the chicken is fried to a crispy golden brown, creating a satisfying crunch with every bite.

The sandwich is assembled on toasted bread, which adds a delightful contrast to the succulent chicken. Topped with sliced pickles that provide a refreshing zing, the sandwich is then generously slathered with a creamy, savory sauce that brings all the flavors together.

Now, what sets this Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich apart and makes it better than burgers? First and foremost, it's the irresistible combination of textures and flavors. The crispy and flavorful chicken, paired with the tangy pickles and creamy sauce, creates an explosion of taste that's hard to match. Additionally, the marination and seasoning of the chicken elevate its taste, making it incredibly flavorful throughout, while burgers often rely heavily on condiments for flavor.

Furthermore, the homemade sauce adds a unique touch that sets it apart from typical burger toppings. The mix of mayo, garlic powder, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, and black pepper creates a luscious and tangy sauce that complements the fried chicken perfectly.

Lastly, the crispy fried chicken sandwich allows for more customization. You can adjust the spice level of the hot sauce and seasoning rub to suit your taste preferences, ensuring that every bite is tailored to your liking.

directions.Direction: Fill a large pot or sous vide container with water and set your immersion circulator to 125°F for medium-rare doneness. If you prefer a different level of doneness, adjust the temperature accordingly.
Pat the Porterhouse steak dry with paper towels and season it generously with salt and freshly ground black pepper on both sides.

Place the seasoned steak in a vacuum-sealed bag or a heavy-duty resealable plastic bag. Add 2 tablespoons of butter (cut into knobs) to the bag. Seal the bag using a vacuum sealer or the water displacement method (slowly lower the bag into the water, allowing the pressure of the water to push out the air, and then seal the bag tightly).

Submerge the bag in the preheated water bath, ensuring the steak is fully covered by the water. Sous vide the Porterhouse steak at 125°F for 1 to 2 hours. The longer you cook, the more tender it will become, but 1.5 to 2 hours should be sufficient.

In a small saucepan, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-low heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the garlic becomes fragrant. Remove the garlic butter from heat and set it aside.
Once the steak has finished cooking in the sous vide bath, remove it from the bag and pat it dry with paper towels. Preheat a heavy skillet or grill pan over high heat.
Add a splash of high smoke point oil (e.g., canola or grapeseed oil) to the hot pan and carefully place the steak in it. Sear the steak for about 2 minutes per side, or until a beautiful crust forms.

Transfer the seared Porterhouse steak to a cutting board and top it with the garlic butter, allowing it to melt and infuse the meat with flavor. Optionally, garnish with fresh thyme sprigs for an aromatic touch.
Tent the steak with aluminum foil or cover it with a bowl and let it rest for about 10 minutes. Resting allows the juices to redistribute, ensuring a juicy and tender final result.
After resting, slice the Porterhouse steak across the bone to separate the filet and the strip portions. Arrange the slices on a serving platter and pour any remaining garlic butter over the top.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: The Perfect Steak
Description: The Sous Vide Porterhouse Steak with Garlic Butter is an easy and foolproof method to achieve a perfect steak every time. By using sous vide cooking, you can precisely control the steak's internal temperature, resulting in tender, juicy, and evenly cooked meat. The process involves seasoning the porterhouse steak with salt and pepper, vacuum-sealing it with knobs of butter, and immersing it in a water bath at 125°F. After the desired time, the steak is seared for a beautiful crust, and then topped with a flavorful garlic butter sauce. The steak is finally rested to allow the juices to redistribute, ensuring a mouthwatering dining experience. This method guarantees consistent and delicious results, making it a go-to choice for steak enthusiasts of all skill levels.

directions.Direction: In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown the ground beef over medium heat, breaking it into small pieces as it cooks. Once the beef is fully cooked, drain any excess fat.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot with the beef. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onions are translucent and the garlic becomes fragrant.
Pour in the beef broth, tomato sauce, and diced tomatoes. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
Add the chopped cabbage to the pot, along with the oregano, basil, and paprika. Season with salt and pepper to your taste preference. Stir everything well.
Bring the soup to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes. This allows the flavors to meld together and the cabbage to become tender.
Stir in the Worcestershire sauce and white rice. Let the soup simmer for an additional 30-45 minutes or until the rice is fully cooked and tender.
Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning as needed with more salt and pepper, if desired.
Serve the Cabbage Roll Soup hot in bowls. You can garnish it with some fresh chopped parsley or a dollop of sour cream if you prefer.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Cabbage Roll Soup
Description: Cabbage Roll Soup is a hearty and comforting dish that combines the flavors of traditional cabbage rolls with a delicious tomato-based broth. This soup is packed with tender ground beef, hearty cabbage, and a rich blend of herbs and spices, creating a perfect balance of flavors. It's a filling and satisfying meal that will warm you up on a cold day. The recipe below serves 6-8 people, making it great for a family dinner or leftovers for the week.

ingredients.Name: chicken feet, cleaned and snipped at the tips
red chili peppers, finely chopped (adjust to your spice preference)

directions.Direction: Begin by preparing the chicken feet. Rinse them thoroughly and snip the tips off using a sharp pair of kitchen shears. This step will help the feet absorb the flavors better.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and add the cleaned chicken feet. Boil for 5 minutes to partially cook them. Drain the feet and pat them dry with a paper towel.
Preheat your air fryer to 390°F (200°C).

Toss the partially cooked chicken feet in cooking oil until they are well coated. Place them in the air fryer basket in a single layer and cook for 10 minutes until they turn crispy and golden brown. Shake the basket halfway through to ensure even cooking.
Once done, transfer the air-fried chicken feet to an ice bath and place them in the refrigerator to chill.

While the chicken feet are chilling, prepare the spicy glaze. In a pan over medium heat, add a tablespoon of cooking oil and sauté the minced garlic, ginger, and chopped chili peppers until aromatic and lightly browned.
Add the chilled chicken feet to the pan, along with rice vinegar, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar, and water. Stir everything together to coat the chicken feet with the glaze.
Bring the mixture to a boil and let it simmer covered for a few minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken feet evenly.
Once the spicy glaze has thickened and coated the chicken feet, remove them from the pan and place them on a serving platter.
Drizzle the chicken feet with the kimchi mayo and garnish with chopped chives for a burst of freshness.
Drizzle the chicken feet with the kimchi mayo and garnish with chopped chives for a burst of freshness.
For the Kimchi Mayo (Optional)
Meanwhile, make the quick kimchi mayo. In a blender, mix mayonnaise, finely chopped kimchi, and a teaspoon of kimchi brine until well combined. Adjust the amount of kimchi to your taste.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Crispy Chicken Feet
Description:
Crispy Chicken Feet with Spicy Glaze:
This tantalizing dish features chicken feet that have been partially boiled, air-fried to a delightful crispiness, and then coated in a flavorful spicy glaze. The glaze, made with a combination of garlic, ginger, chili peppers, rice vinegar, oyster sauce, soy sauce, and sugar, adds a perfect balance of sweet, tangy, and spicy notes to the chicken feet. The result is a delectable treat with a satisfying crunch on the outside and succulent meat on the inside. The dish is served chilled, making it a great appetizer or a unique snack for those who enjoy exploring different culinary experiences.

Kimchi Mayo:
The accompaniment to the crispy chicken feet is a zesty and creamy kimchi mayo. This quick and easy-to-make mayo is a fusion of traditional mayo and the vibrant flavors of kimchi. Chopped kimchi is blended with mayonnaise and a splash of kimchi brine, resulting in a tangy, slightly spicy, and incredibly addictive dipping sauce. The kimchi mayo complements the chicken feet perfectly, adding a refreshing and tangy element to the overall dish. Together, they create a harmonious and delightful combination that will surely leave taste buds craving for more.

ingredients.Name: large piece of pig skin with fat trimmed off

directions.Direction: Rinse the pig skin thoroughly and pat it dry with paper towels. Generously season the pig skin with salt and place it in the refrigerator overnight to allow the flavors to meld and the skin to firm up.
In a skillet or pan over medium heat, brown the chopped pork belly until it's crispy and golden. Season it with 1 tablespoon of chili powder and salt. Set it aside.
In the same skillet, toast the rice until it's lightly golden. Add the minced garlic and cook for a minute until aromatic.
Pour in the chicken stock, chili flakes, pepper, and salt. Stir in the tomato paste and kidney beans. Allow it to come to a gentle boil.
Reduce the heat, cover the skillet, and let the rice simmer until it is just slightly undercooked. This will ensure the rice is fully cooked during the baking process.
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
Take the seasoned pig skin out of the refrigerator. Using a sharp knife, poke small holes around the edges of the skin to create a pouch. Leave one end open for stuffing.
Fill the pig skin pouch with the prepared rice and pork belly filling. Press it gently to ensure it's well-packed but not overly tight.
Use butcher's twine to sew the open end shut securely, creating a tightly sealed sack.
Coat the outside of the pig skin with a thin layer of oil and sprinkle with paprika for a beautiful color.

Place the stuffed and sewn pig skin on a baking sheet or roasting pan and bake in the preheated oven at 350°F for about 3 hours. This slow cooking process will help render the fat and make the skin crispy.
