Increase the oven temperature to 425°F and continue baking for an additional 30 minutes or until the skin turns crispy and golden.
Once fully cooked and crisped, remove the Cuerito Relleno from the oven.
Allow it to cool slightly before slicing into portions.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Cuerito Relleno
Description: Cuerito Relleno is a traditional and savory dish made with salted and stuffed pig skin. This delicacy features a flavorful filling of browned pork belly, seasoned rice, and kidney beans, all enclosed within the pig skin pouch. The dish is then baked to perfection, resulting in a crispy and mouthwatering treat that will surely impress your guests. Prepare this unique and hearty dish for a special occasion or as a culinary adventure for your taste buds.

ingredients.Name: leftover cooked turkey, shredded or diced

directions.Direction: Lay one egg roll wrapper on a clean surface with one corner facing you (diamond shape). Make a thin line of mayonnaise and place about 2-4 tablespoons of turkey and stuffing in the center of the wrapper. Fold the corner closest to you over the filling, tucking it in tightly. Fold in the left and right corners towards the center. Moisten the top corner with a little water and then roll the egg roll tightly, sealing the edge. Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
In a deep frying pan or a pot, heat enough oil for deep-frying over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°F (180°C). Use a candy thermometer to monitor the temperature.

Carefully place 2-3 egg rolls at a time into the hot oil, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Fry them for about 2-3 minutes per side or until they turn golden brown and crispy. Use tongs to flip them if needed. Once done, transfer the egg rolls to a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil. Repeat the frying process until all egg rolls are cooked.
Arrange the crispy leftover turkey egg rolls on a serving platter and serve them warm alongside a bowl of gravy or cranberry sauce for dipping.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Leftover Turkey Egg Rolls
Description: Leftover Turkey Egg Rolls are the ultimate fusion of Thanksgiving flavors and Asian-inspired cuisine. These delectable treats take your traditional turkey and stuffing leftovers and turn them into a delightful and crispy handheld snack. The egg roll wrappers are filled with a luscious mix of shredded or diced leftover turkey and savory stuffing. To elevate the flavors and add a creamy touch, mayo is mixed in, providing a luxurious creaminess that binds everything together.

directions.Direction: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Bake the Potatoes: Place the clean russet potatoes on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 45-60 minutes or until the potatoes are fork-tender.
In a large pan over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add the diced onions and sauté for 3-5 minutes until they become translucent.
Add the ground beef to the pan with the onions and cook until the beef is browned, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks.
Stir in the tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, and minced garlic, and cook for another 1-2 minutes to let the flavors meld.
Add the diced carrots and peas to the pan, then pour in the beef broth. Simmer the mixture until the liquid has reduced and the sauce has thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Once the potatoes are cooked and slightly cooled, carefully slice off a thin layer from the top of each potato. Using a spoon, carefully hollow out the centers of the potatoes, leaving a sturdy shell.

Place the scooped-out potato flesh into a mixing bowl. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and heavy cream to the bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Mash the potato mixture until smooth.
Transfer the beef and vegetable mixture into the mashed potato bowl and mix thoroughly to combine. Spoon the filling into a piping bag fitted with a large round tip.
Carefully fill each hollowed potato shell with the shepherd's pie filling using the piping bag. The potato filling should create a layer over the pie mixture.
Sprinkle paprika and chopped chives over the top of each stuffed potato for added flavor and presentation.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Shepard's Pie Potato
Description:
Shepherd's Pie Stuffed Potatoes combine the comforting flavors of classic Shepherd's Pie with the delightful twist of being served in a wholesome and satisfying potato shell. This hearty dish starts with fork-tender baked russet potatoes that are hollowed out, creating a perfect vessel for the rich and flavorful filling.

The filling consists of savory ground beef cooked with aromatic onions and garlic, along with sweet diced carrots and tender peas. The addition of tomato paste and Worcestershire sauce infuses the mixture with a robust umami taste, while beef broth adds a depth of savory goodness. The result is a thick, luscious pie filling that's generously spooned into the scooped-out potatoes.

The mashed potato mixture, made with creamy butter and heavy cream, serves as a delectable lid over the pie filling, adding a smooth and delightful contrast in each bite. The piped potato topping not only looks visually appealing but also provides an enjoyable combination of textures.

Topped with a sprinkle of paprika and a garnish of chopped chives, these Shepherd's Pie Stuffed Potatoes are a feast for the eyes and the taste buds. This dish is a perfect balance of hearty and comforting flavors, making it a delightful option for a wholesome family dinner or a special gathering with friends. Enjoy the blend of familiar and innovative tastes in this creative take on a classic favorite.

ingredients.Name: fresh salmon filets, skin removed and sliced into thin strips
cayenne pepper (adjust to your spice preference)

directions.Direction: Slice the salmon filets into thin strips, ensuring that all skin and bones are removed. Pat them dry with a paper towel to remove any excess moisture.
In a pot, bring water to a boil and add the ginger paste. The ginger will infuse its flavor into the water, which will later be used to poach the salmon.

Carefully add the salmon strips to the boiling water and ginger mixture. Allow the salmon to cook until it becomes extremely tender and flakes easily. This overcooking process is crucial to achieving the desired flossy texture. This may take around 10-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your salmon strips. Be cautious not to overcook to the point of mushiness.
Once the salmon is cooked and tender, drain any excess liquid and transfer the poached salmon strips into a large bowl. Using a fork or a spoon, mash the salmon until it turns into fine flakes.
In a separate bowl, combine sugar, minced garlic, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and soy sauce. Mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.

Pour the spice blend over the mashed salmon in the large bowl. Mix thoroughly to ensure the salmon is coated evenly with the spices. The combination of flavors will infuse into the salmon, enhancing its taste.

Transfer the seasoned salmon back into a pan on low heat. Stir constantly to prevent burning and to ensure even drying. The mixture will gradually become drier, and the salmon will turn fluffy as it absorbs the flavors from the spices. This process will take around 15-20 minutes.
Once the salmon has reached the desired dry and fluffy texture, remove it from the heat and let it cool completely. As it cools, it will further dry and develop its characteristic flossy texture.
Once completely cooled, transfer the salmon floss to an airtight container. It can be stored in the refrigerator for up to a week, but it's so delicious that it might not last that long!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Salmon Floss
Description: Salmon floss is a delightful and savory dish that features tender flakes of salmon infused with a blend of aromatic spices. It's a perfect addition to your meals, whether as a protein-packed topping for rice, noodles, or salads, or as a delicious filling for sandwiches and wraps. This recipe provides step-by-step instructions to create a mouthwatering salmon floss that is both flavorful and fluffy.

ingredients.Name: pink curing salt (optional, for that classic pink Spam color)

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 350°F. Grease a loaf tin with cooking spray or oil to prevent sticking.
Grind the pork shoulder to a coarse paste-like texture.
Take the smoked ham and cut it into smaller pieces for easier blending.
In a food processor, combine the smoked ham pieces with the peeled garlic cloves.
Blend until you have a smooth, uniform mixture of ham and garlic.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground pork shoulder with the smoked ham and garlic blend.
Thoroughly mix everything together until the ham and garlic are evenly distributed throughout the ground pork.
Sprinkle curing salt over the ground pork and ham blend.
Use your hands to knead and mix the salt into the meat until everything is well combined.
In a food processor, combine the smoked ham pieces with the peeled garlic cloves.
Blend until you have a smooth, uniform mixture of ham and garlic. Set aside.
Mix the Ground Pork and Smoked Ham Blend:
In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground pork shoulder with the smoked ham and garlic blend.
Thoroughly mix everything together until the ham and garlic are evenly distributed throughout the ground pork.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared loaf tin, pressing it down firmly to ensure it's compact and free of air pockets.
Place the loaf tin inside a larger baking dish or roasting pan. Fill the larger dish with enough hot water to create a water bath around the loaf tin, about halfway up the sides.
Carefully place the water bath with the loaf tin in the preheated oven and bake for about 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).
Once cooked, remove the loaf tin from the water bath and allow the homemade Spam to cool to room temperature.

Place a weight or a heavy object on top of the cooled Spam to compress it further. You can use another loaf tin with some weights inside it for this purpose. Pressing it will help to achieve a compact and uniform texture.
Once the homemade Spam has been pressed, remove it from the loaf tin, slice it, and enjoy it however you like – fried, in sandwiches, or with your favorite side dishes.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Spam
Description: This delightful homemade Spam recipe takes inspiration from the classic canned meat but elevates it to a whole new level of flavor and quality. Using a blend of succulent pork shoulder and richly smoked ham, combined with the aromatic essence of garlic cloves, this unique rendition will impress even the most discerning palates. The process of making your own Spam at home ensures that you have full control over the ingredients, allowing you to create a product that's free from additives and preservatives, resulting in a mouthwatering treat that's perfect for sandwiches, breakfast, or as an accompaniment to a variety of dishes.

ingredients.Name: shredded cheddar cheese (or any cheese of your choice)
Your favorite sauce (e.g., ketchup, hot sauce, or salsa)

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 425°F. Grease a standard 12-cup muffin tin with cooking spray or oil.

Place four tater tots in each muffin cup, gently smashing them to create a base and shaping them to form a small indent in the center. The tater tots should cover the bottom and partially line the sides of each cup.
Sprinkle a generous amount of shredded cheese into the indent of each tater tot cup.
Bake the tater tots in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until they become slightly crispy and golden.

While the tater tots are baking, cook the chopped bacon in a frying pan over medium heat until it becomes crispy and the fat has rendered out. Transfer the cooked bacon to a plate lined with paper towels to drain the excess grease.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten. Optionally, season the eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper to taste.
Once the tater tots have baked for 10 minutes, remove the muffin tin from the oven. Carefully spoon the rendered bacon into the cheese-filled indent of each tater tot cup.
Pour the scrambled eggs into each cup, filling them almost to the top. The eggs will puff up slightly during baking, so don't overfill.
Return the muffin tin to the oven and bake for an additional 20 minutes or until the eggs are fully cooked and set.
Once the tater tot breakfast cups are done baking, remove them from the oven and allow them to cool for a few minutes in the muffin tin.
Garnish each cup with chopped chives for a burst of freshness and added flavor.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Tater Tot Egg Cups
Description: The combination of crispy tater tots, melted cheese, savory bacon, fluffy scrambled eggs, and a hint of chives creates a satisfying and flavorful breakfast that is sure to be a hit at any brunch or morning gathering. It's a simple and versatile recipe, allowing for various customizations to suit individual tastes and preferences.

directions.Direction: Activate the Yeast: In a small bowl, combine the warm milk and sugar. Sprinkle the instant yeast over the milk mixture and let it sit for about 5-10 minutes, or until the yeast becomes frothy.

Mix the Dough: In a large mixing bowl, combine the bread flour and salt. Pour in the yeast mixture and melted butter. Stir everything together until a dough forms. If the dough is too sticky, add a little more flour, a tablespoon at a time, until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Knead the Dough: Transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead it for about 5-7 minutes, or until it becomes smooth and springs back when you press it with your finger.
Cover the dough under a dry towel, for about 25 minutes to 1 hour, or until it doubles in size.
Prepare the Cheese: While the dough is rising, cut the mozzarella cheese into small chunks.

Once the dough has risen, punch it down to release the air. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls, depending on how big you want the buns to be. Take each portion, flatten it slightly, and add a few chunks of mozzarella cheese to the center. Close the dough around the cheese, shaping it back into a ball. Make sure to seal the edges tightly.
Lightly cover in oil and place the filled dough balls on a pan on low heat until both sides turn golden. Roughly 8-10 minutes per side.
Once off the stove, you can garnish the buns with garlic butter. Serve the Easy Cheesy Garlic Buns warm, and enjoy them as a delightful snack or as a side dish to complement your favorite meal!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Cheese Filled Garlic Buns
Description:
These Easy Cheesy Garlic Buns are delightful and flavorful treats that boast a soft and fluffy texture. Each bun is generously filled with chunks of gooey mozzarella cheese and infused with the savory essence of minced garlic. The dough is prepared with love, using a combination of bread flour, warm milk, and butter, resulting in a light and airy base that complements the rich cheese and garlic filling.

Cooked to perfection in a frying pan on low heat, these buns develop a golden-brown crust on the outside while maintaining a tender interior. The low-heat cooking method ensures that the cheese melts thoroughly, creating a luscious molten center that oozes with every bite.

With their irresistible aroma of warm garlic and cheesy goodness, these buns are perfect as a satisfying snack or as a delightful accompaniment to any meal. Whether you serve them at gatherings, parties, or simply enjoy them for yourself, these Easy Cheesy Garlic Buns are sure to be a crowd-pleaser, leaving everyone craving for more of their cheesy comfort and garlicky charm.

ingredients.Name: Sesame seeds, chives, and paprika for garnish

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C).

Carefully separate the egg yolks from the egg whites. Place the egg whites in a well-greased muffin tin and the other half with your yolks. (Optional: Add sausage, bacon, or veggies to your egg whites)
Place your muffin tray on a larger tray. fill the bottom tray 2 cups of water and cover both trays with aluminium foil. (We're  essentially steaming the eggs because it will have a better texture)
Bake in the oven for 15 minutes or until they are set.
Once the egg whites and yolks are done baking and have cooled, prepare the deviled egg filling.
In a food processor, combine the baked egg yolks, mayonnaise, yellow mustard, hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Process the mixture until it becomes smooth and creamy. Adjust if needed.
Scoop the deviled egg filling into a piping bag fitted with a decorative tip of your choice.
Carefully pipe the deviled egg filling onto the top of each egg white cupcake.
To garnish, sprinkle some sesame seeds, finely chopped chives, and a dash of paprika on top of each deviled egg cupcake.
Serve the deviled egg cupcakes immediately, or refrigerate them for a short while before serving for a refreshing appetizer.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Deviled Egg Cupcakes
Description: Deviled Egg Cupcakes are a delightful twist on the classic deviled eggs, served in a charming and individualized format. The recipe begins with separating the egg whites into a muffin tin, giving them a perfect cupcake shape. Meanwhile, the egg yolks are gently baked to enhance their flavor and create a creamy consistency.

ingredients.Name: chili flakes (adjust to your spice preference)
sun dried tomatoes, chopped (in oil or rehydrated)

directions.Direction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Slice each chicken breast in half lengthwise to make two thinner cutlets. Season both sides of the chicken with salt, pepper, and half of the chili flakes. Set aside.

In an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat, add the olive oil. Once the oil is hot, add the seasoned chicken breasts. Cook each side for about 1-2 minutes or until they develop a golden-brown color. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set it aside on a plate.
In the same skillet, lower the heat to medium and add the minced garlic. Sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant but not browned.
Pour in the chicken broth, scraping the bottom of the skillet to deglaze and incorporate any browned bits. Let it simmer for 2-3 minutes to reduce slightly.
Stir in the heavy cream, chopped sun-dried tomatoes, dried oregano, dried thyme, and the remaining half of the chili flakes. Let the sauce simmer for another 3-4 minutes until it thickens slightly.
Return the chicken breasts to the skillet, nestling them into the sauce. Simmer for an additional 2 minutes to let the flavors meld.
Sprinkle the grated Parmesan cheese over the chicken and sauce.
Transfer the oven-safe skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked through, and the cheese has melted and turned golden.
Remove the skillet from the oven carefully, as the handle will be hot. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley.
Serve the Marry Me Chicken with your choice of side dishes like rice, pasta, or crusty bread to soak up the delicious sauce.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Marry Me Chicken
Description: Marry Me Chicken is a delightful and flavorful dish that will surely win the hearts of your loved ones. This recipe features succulent chicken breasts, sliced in half lengthwise to ensure even cooking, smothered in a rich creamy sauce infused with sun-dried tomatoes and a hint of chili flakes for a slight kick. The best part is that it's all made in one oven-safe skillet, making it a convenient and impressive dish for any occasion.

directions.Direction: For the Pulled Pork
Preheat your grill or smoker to 105°C (107°C) for low and slow cooking.
Rub the pork butt all over with yellow mustard, ensuring it's coated evenly.
Generously season the pork with your favorite pork rub, massaging it into the meat for better flavor penetration.

Place the seasoned pork butt on the grill or smoker and let it smoke for several hours until it reaches an internal temperature of 90°C (90°C) and is tender enough to shred easily. This could take around 8-10 hours, depending on the size of the pork butt and your cooking setup.
During the smoking process, spray the pork butt with apple juice every hour to keep it moist and enhance the flavor.
For the Corn
Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
Butter and season the corn: Rub each corn cob with softened butter, then sprinkle chili powder, salt, and pepper to taste. Wrap each cob tightly in aluminum foil.
Place the seasoned corn cobs on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes or until the corn is tender.
For the Homemade Mayo

In a food processor or blender, add the egg yolks and process for about 1 minute until creamy. While the processor is still running, slowly drizzle in the vegetable oil until the mixture thickens and emulsifies. Add the rice vinegar and salt, and blend for another 30 seconds until well combined. Transfer the mayo to a jar or container and refrigerate until ready to use.
For the Lime Crema

In a bowl, whisk together the sour cream, lime juice, freshly ground black pepper, minced garlic, and salt until smooth. Adjust seasoning to taste, and keep the crema in the refrigerator until you're ready to assemble the elotes in a cup.
For the Assembly

Once the corn is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool slightly. Cut the kernels off the cobs and place them in a mixing bowl. Add about 1/2 cup of the homemade mayo and 1/2 cup of the lime crema to the corn kernels, mixing well to coat all the corn.

In small cups or glasses, start layering the elotes. Begin with a layer of mayo-crema-coated corn, then add a sprinkle of crumbled cotija cheese. Repeat the layers one or two more times, ending with a final top layer of pulled pork.

Serve and enjoy: Your delicious Elotes in a Cup with Lime Crema and Pulled Pork is now ready to be served. Dig in and savor the flavors of the creamy, tangy lime crema, the savory pulled pork, and the spiced corn with melted butter and chili powder. Enjoy!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Elotes in a Cup
Description: Elotes in a Cup is a delightful and flavorful Mexican-inspired dish that brings together the beloved flavors of sweet corn on the cob, tangy lime crema, and savory pulled pork in a convenient and handheld presentation. The corn cobs are generously seasoned with a mixture of softened butter and chili powder before being baked until tender. The homemade mayo, made creamy and rich with egg yolks and rice vinegar, is combined with a zesty lime crema that features a pinch of fresh pepper and garlic, adding a burst of freshness and tanginess. Assembling the dish is a layered affair, where the spiced corn, coated in the mayo-crema mixture, is complemented with crumbled cotija cheese and topped with succulent pulled pork. Each spoonful offers a harmonious blend of textures and flavors, from the creamy and smoky corn to the tangy crema and the indulgent richness of the pulled pork. Elotes in a Cup is a delightful treat that is not only visually appealing but also a burst of delicious taste that will leave you craving for more. Perfect for parties, gatherings, or simply as a comforting and satisfying meal.

ingredients.Name: chili flakes (adjust to your preferred level of spiciness)

directions.Direction: For the Cowboy Butter
In a small pan, melt the butter over low heat. Once melted, add the chopped chives, thyme, and lemon juice. Stir well to combine.

Add the chili flakes, fresh parsley, minced garlic, salt, and pepper to the pan. If you like some extra heat, add the cayenne pepper as well. Stir everything together and let it cook for a minute or two to infuse the flavors.
Mix in the paprika and lemon zest, stirring until the butter mixture is well combined and fragrant. Take the pan off the heat and let it cool slightly.
For the Cowboy Butter Garlic Bread
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Slice the loaf of bread horizontally.
Spread a generous amount of the prepared cowboy butter mixture between each slice of the bread. Use a brush or spoon to coat the top of the loaf with the remaining butter mixture.
Place the wrapped loaf on a baking sheet and bake the bread in the preheated oven for about 12 minutes, or until the bread is toasted and the butter mixture is melted and bubbly.
Once done, remove the bread from the oven and allow it to cool for a minute or two before serving.
Slice the Cowboy Butter Garlic Bread and serve it warm as a delicious side dish or appetizer for a hearty meal.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Cowboy Butter Garlic Bread
Description:
Cowboy Butter Garlic Bread is an irresistibly flavorful twist on classic garlic bread that will have your taste buds dancing with joy. This hearty and robust bread is infused with a mouthwatering blend of savory and zesty ingredients, making it the perfect accompaniment to any meal or a delightful snack on its own.

The star of this recipe is the Cowboy Butter, a rich and fragrant mixture of melted butter, fresh herbs, and a touch of heat. Chopped chives and thyme add an earthy essence, while the bright tang of lemon juice complements the warmth of chili flakes. A generous amount of chopped parsley adds a fresh burst of color and flavor to the mix.

ingredients.Name: chili flakes (adjust to your preferred level of spiciness)

directions.Direction: In a medium-sized pan, melt the unsalted butter over low heat. Allow it to soften but not brown.
Add the chopped chives, thyme, lemon juice, chili flakes, fresh parsley, and minced garlic to the pan. Stir well to combine the ingredients with the melted butter.
Season the mixture with salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, and paprika. Adjust the seasoning according to your taste preferences.
Continue to cook the butter mixture over low heat for about 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally to ensure the flavors blend together.
Remove the pan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
Once the butter mixture has cooled down a bit, stir in the lemon zest and Dijon mustard. Make sure all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
Transfer the cowboy butter to a small container or a jar. You can also shape it into a log using plastic wrap for easy slicing later.
Refrigerate the cowboy butter until it firms up and is ready to use. It will keep well in the refrigerator for several weeks.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Cowboy Butter
Description: Cowboy Butter is a flavorful compound butter that brings the wild and robust spirit of the West to your kitchen. This savory, herb-infused butter is bursting with a delightful mix of zesty and spicy flavors, making it a versatile condiment to elevate your dishes.

ingredients.Name: chili garlic sauce (adjust to your preferred spice level)

directions.Direction: For the Sauce
Prepare the Sauce: In a small mixing bowl, combine the mayonnaise, chili garlic sauce, rice vinegar, and black pepper. Mix well until the sauce is smooth and all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
For the Shrimp
Prepare the Shrimp: Pat dry the peeled and deveined shrimp with paper towels. Season them with salt and pepper to taste and set them aside.

Soak Vermicelli Rice Noodles: Place the vermicelli rice noodles in a bowl and pour the rice wine vinegar over them. Let them soak until they become soft and pliable, following the package instructions if available. Once they are ready, drain any excess vinegar.
Wrap the Noodles around the Shrimp: Take a soaked rice noodle and wrap it around a shrimp, ensuring it covers the entire shrimp. Repeat with the remaining shrimp and noodles.

Fry the Shrimp: In a deep saucepan or frying pan, heat enough vegetable oil over medium-high heat until it reaches around 350°F (175°C). Carefully place the wrapped shrimp in the hot oil and fry them until they turn golden brown and crispy, which should take about 2-3 minutes per side. Avoid overcrowding the pan; fry them in batches if necessary.
Coat the Shrimp with Sauce: Once the shrimp are fried and crispy, use a brush or spoon to coat each shrimp generously with the prepared sauce.

Serve: Arrange the twisted bang bang shrimp on a serving platter and garnish with some chopped green onions or cilantro for added freshness and color. Serve immediately while they are still hot and crispy.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Twisted Bang Bang Shrimp
Description: Twisted Bang Bang Shrimp is a mouthwatering and visually appealing appetizer that combines succulent shrimp with rice vermicelli noodles, fried to golden perfection. The dish starts by soaking the rice noodles in rice wine vinegar until they become soft and flexible. Then, each shrimp is wrapped with a rice noodle and fried in hot oil until crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.

ingredients.Name: sushi rice, cooked and seasoned (can be optional, for extra texture)
shredded lettuce (romaine or iceberg works well)

directions.Direction: For the Bacon Weave
Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
Lay out a sheet of parchment paper on a baking sheet.
Create a bacon weave by laying out the bacon strips horizontally, slightly overlapping each other.
Fold back every other bacon strip to the halfway point.
Place a new bacon strip vertically across the unfolded bacon strips.
Unfold the folded bacon strips back over the new strip.
Now, fold back the alternate bacon strips that were not folded in step "d" to the halfway point.
Place another bacon strip vertically across the unfolded bacon strips.
Unfold the folded bacon strips back over the new strip. Repeat until a tight weave is made.

Season and Bake the Bacon: Sprinkle freshly ground black pepper over the bacon weave. Carefully transfer the bacon weave onto the parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until the bacon is crispy and cooked to your liking. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
For the Assemble the BLT Sushi
Drizzle a generous layer of mayonnaise across the center of the entire bacon weave.
Layer the thin-sliced tomatoes and shredded lettuce on top of the mayo.

Roll the Sushi: Gently lift one end of the bacon weave with the help of the parchment paper. Start rolling the bacon weave over the filling, using the parchment paper to guide and tighten the roll. Continue rolling until the entire sushi roll is formed.
For the Slice and Serve
With a sharp knife, slice the BLT sushi roll into bite-sized pieces. Arrange the sushi pieces on a serving platter.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: BLT Sushi
Description: BLT Sushi is a creative twist on traditional sushi, bringing together the beloved flavors of a classic BLT sandwich in a unique and visually appealing way. This unconventional sushi roll replaces the traditional seaweed wrapper and rice with a bacon weave seasoned with pepper, giving it a smoky and savory essence. The bacon is perfectly baked to a crispy perfection, adding a delightful crunch to each bite. A layer of creamy mayo serves as the "glue" to hold all the components together, while thin-sliced tomatoes and crisp lettuce contribute a fresh and refreshing element.

directions.Direction: For the Cannelloni Pasta:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the cannelloni pasta tubes and cook them according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta and set it aside.
For the Meatball Filling:
In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, dried parsley, minced garlic, grated Parmesan cheese, breadcrumbs, egg, salt, and pepper. Mix everything together thoroughly until well combined.
For the Pasta Tubes:

Carefully stuff each cannelloni pasta tube with the prepared meatball filling. Using a small spoon or your fingers, gently pack the meat mixture into the tubes. Be careful not to overstuff, as the pasta may burst during frying.
Take a wooden skewer and carefully pierce it through the length of each stuffed cannelloni tube. The skewer will hold the pasta together during frying and make it easier to handle.
Prepare three shallow bowls. In the first bowl, place all-purpose flour. In the second bowl, whisk the remaining egg. In the third bowl, add more breadcrumbs.
Roll each skewered stuffed pasta first in flour, then dip it in the beaten egg, and finally coat it with breadcrumbs, ensuring an even and thick coating.
In a deep skillet or frying pan, heat enough oil for frying over medium-high heat. Carefully add the coated pasta skewers to the hot oil.
Fry the meatball-stuffed pasta for about 8 minutes or until they turn golden brown and crispy on all sides.
Remove the pasta skewers from the oil and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
For the Marinara Dip:
While the pasta is frying, warm up the marinara sauce in a small saucepan over low heat.
Arrange the crispy Meatball-Stuffed Pasta on a Stick on a serving platter. Serve with the warm marinara sauce on the side for dipping.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Meatball Pasta on a Stick
Description: Meatball-Stuffed Pasta on a Stick is a delightful and innovative twist on traditional meatballs and pasta. Cannelloni pasta tubes are boiled to perfection and then generously stuffed with a flavorful mixture of ground beef, herbs, cheese, and breadcrumbs. The stuffed pasta is skewered with wooden sticks for easy handling and fun presentation. It's then coated with a crispy crust and lightly fried to golden brown perfection. Served with a side of rich marinara sauce for dipping, this dish will be a hit at any gathering or family dinner.

ingredients.Name: Your favorite chicken rub (store  bought or homemade)

directions.Direction: Preheat the oven or air fryer to 350°F.
Prepare the Chicken Wings: Pat dry the chicken wings with paper towels to remove any excess moisture. Generously coat the wings with your favorite chicken rub, ensuring they are evenly seasoned.

Bake the Chicken Wings: Place the seasoned chicken wings on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Bake the wings in the preheated oven until they are barely cooked through and the skin is crispy; about 20-25 minutes. This will create a crispy base for the bubble wings.
Prepare the Rice Paper: While the chicken wings are baking, prepare the rice paper. Take each sheet of rice paper and cut it into 4 sections, creating smaller pieces.

Wet and Stretch the Rice Paper: Fill a shallow dish or tray with water. Dip one section of rice paper into the water for a few seconds until it becomes pliable. Carefully stretch the wet rice paper over a cooked chicken wing, covering it completely. The rice paper should stick to the crispy skin, creating a "bubble" effect as it fries.

Fry the Bubble Wings: In a deep fryer or a large, deep skillet, heat vegetable oil to 350°F (175°C). Carefully lower the rice paper-covered chicken wings into the hot oil, a few at a time, to avoid overcrowding the fryer. Fry the wings until the rice paper turns bubbly and golden brown, which should take around 2-3 minutes per wing.

Coat with Wing Sauce: Remove the fried bubble wings from the oil and let them drain on a paper towel-lined plate to remove excess oil. Brush your favorite wing sauce generously over the crispy rice paper, ensuring it's evenly coated and infused with delicious flavors.
Serve and Enjoy: Serve the Crispy Fried Bubble Wings immediately as they are best enjoyed when they are fresh and hot.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Crispy Bubble Chicken Wings
Description: These Crispy Fried Bubble Wings are an exciting twist on traditional chicken wings, with the crunchy and flavorful rice paper adding a unique texture and appearance. The combination of the juicy chicken wings, savory chicken rub, crispy rice paper, and flavorful wing sauce will surely impress your family and guests at any gathering or party. Enjoy the delightful fusion of crispy and bubbly goodness in every bite!

ingredients.Name: large egg yolks (fresh, high quality eggs)

directions.Direction: Separate the yolks: Carefully crack the eggs and separate the yolks from the whites. Be gentle to keep the yolks intact.
Prepare the curing mixture: Add kosher salt to an airtight container high enough to fully cover the yolk.

Curing the yolks: Create a small indentation in the curing mixture. Place each yolk gently into its own indentation, making sure they are well-spaced apart. Carefully cover each yolk completely, ensuring all sides are coated.

Curing time: Wrap the bowl tightly with plastic wrap or with a lid and place it in the refrigerator. Let the egg yolks cure for 4 to 7 days, depending on your desired consistency. The longer they cure, the firmer they will become. You can start checking the yolks after 4 days to see if they have reached your preferred texture.

Removing the curing mixture: Once the curing process is complete, carefully remove the egg yolks from the curing mixture. Gently brush off any excess salt and sugar, then rinse them under cold running water to remove any remaining mixture.
Drying the yolks: Pat the cured egg yolks dry with paper towels, being careful not to break them. Place them on a wire rack and bake at the lowest temperature for an hour.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Egg Yolk "Cheese"
Description: Cured egg yolks are a delightful and unique ingredient that adds a burst of intense flavor to various dishes. They are made by preserving egg yolks in salt, which results in a concentrated and slightly firm yolk that can be grated or shaved over dishes to impart a rich, umami flavor. These golden gems can elevate salads, pasta, and rice dishes, or even be served as a garnish for soups and stews. The process of curing enhances the natural taste of the egg yolk, giving it a more concentrated and complex flavor profile.

ingredients.Name: Frank's Red Hot sauce (or any other hot sauce of your choice)

directions.Direction: In a large bowl, mix buttermilk, pickle juice, cayenne pepper, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt. Stir well until all the spices are well combined.

Add the cleaned and skinned frog legs to the buttermilk brine. Make sure the frog legs are completely submerged. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour, allowing the flavors to penetrate the meat.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour with a pinch of cayenne pepper, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt. This will be used for breading the frog legs.
Remove the frog legs from the buttermilk brine, allowing any excess liquid to drip off. Dredge the frog legs in the seasoned flour mixture, making sure they are coated evenly.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet or a fryer to 375°F (190°C). The oil should be about 1-2 inches deep.

Carefully place the breaded frog legs into the hot oil, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Fry the legs in batches if necessary. Cook each batch for about 4 minutes, turning occasionally, until they are golden brown and crispy.
Once cooked, remove the frog legs from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
For the Homemade Buffalo Sauce:
In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat until fully melted.
Add the Frank's Red Hot sauce to the melted butter. Stir well until the sauce is well combined and heated through.
In a large bowl, place the fried frog legs and pour the homemade buffalo sauce over them. Toss the legs gently in the sauce until they are evenly coated.
Serve the fried frog legs with homemade buffalo sauce alongside your favorite dipping sauces, such as ranch dressing or blue cheese dressing.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Fried Frog Legs
Description:
Fried Frog Legs with Homemade Buffalo Sauce is a delightful and flavorful dish that offers a unique culinary experience. The dish features tender frog legs, marinated in a zesty buttermilk brine infused with cayenne, pepper, garlic, onion powder, and pickle juice. This marinade not only adds a tangy kick but also helps to tenderize and enhance the delicate flavor of the frog legs.

After a satisfying soak in the brine, the frog legs are coated in a seasoned flour mixture, which gives them a crunchy and golden-brown crust when fried to perfection in hot oil. The result is a delectable combination of crispy exterior and succulent, juicy meat on the inside.

To take the dish up a notch, the fried frog legs are then generously tossed in a homemade buffalo sauce made with melted butter and Frank's Red Hot sauce. The sauce adds a delightful spicy and tangy note, elevating the flavors to create an exciting contrast with the crispy fried coating.

With its unique taste and impressive presentation, Fried Frog Legs with Homemade Buffalo Sauce makes for an adventurous and memorable appetizer or main course that is sure to be a conversation starter at any gathering or special occasion.

ingredients.Name: steaks (e.g., ribeye or New York strip), about 1 thick

directions.Direction: For the Cajun Compound Butter

Prepare the Cajun Compound Butter: In a food processor or blender, combine the softened butter and Cajun seasoning. Blend until well combined and the seasoning is evenly distributed. Lay a sheet of plastic wrap on a clean surface and transfer the butter mixture to the center. Form the butter into a log shape and wrap it tightly with plastic wrap. Place it in the freezer to firm up.
For the Sous Vide Steaks

Sous Vide the Steaks: Preheat the sous vide water bath to 120 degrees Fahrenheit. Season the steaks with French grey salt and garlic powder on both sides. Place each steak in a separate vacuum-sealed bag and add 2 tablespoons of butter to each bag. Seal the bags and place them in the preheated water bath. Sous vide the steaks for 1 hour.

Sear the Steaks: Remove the steaks from the sous vide bags and pat them dry with paper towels. Heat a cast-iron skillet or grill pan over high heat. Sear the steaks for 1-2 minutes per side to develop a crust. You can baste them with the melted butter from the sous vide bags during searing.
For the Pasta

Prepare the Alfredo Sauce: In a saucepan over medium heat, melt 1/2 cup of butter. Add the diced garlic cloves and sauté for a minute until fragrant. Pour in the heavy cream and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer. Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese, cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper. Continue stirring until the cheese is fully melted and the sauce thickens slightly. Keep warm on low heat.
Cook the Pasta: Cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente according to the package instructions. Drain the pasta and set aside.
For the Assembly

Assemble the Dish: Toss the cooked pasta with the prepared Alfredo sauce until well coated. Divide the pasta into serving plates. Slice the seared steaks and place them on top of the pasta. Take the Cajun Compound Butter out of the freezer and cut thin slices to place over the steak and pasta.
Torch the Butter: Using a culinary torch, gently torch the Cajun Compound Butter slices until they start to melt and create a beautiful glaze over the dish.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Steak Alfredo with Cajun Butter
Description: Steak Alfredo Pasta with Cajun Butter is a delectable fall favorite that combines the richness of Alfredo sauce with the comforting flavors of Cajun seasoning and perfectly cooked sous vide steaks. The dish features succulent, perfectly seared steaks, seasoned with French grey salt and garlic powder, offering a hearty and satisfying taste. The creamy homemade Alfredo sauce, made with butter, cream, Parmesan cheese, and a touch of cajun seasoning, provides a velvety texture and a warm, comforting flavor profile that perfectly complements the cooler fall weather. The addition of the Cajun compound butter, with its delightful blend of spices, adds a burst of bold and aromatic taste to the dish, elevating it to a whole new level of indulgence. When served over fettuccine pasta and garnished with torch-melted Cajun butter, this delightful fall favorite becomes a delicious symphony of flavors that will leave you craving more with each comforting bite.

directions.Direction: In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the egg, hot sauce, mustard, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper to make the shrimp marinade.
Add the shrimp to the marinade, tossing to coat them thoroughly. Let the shrimp marinate in the mixture for about 15-20 minutes.
In another bowl, prepare the dredge by combining the flour, cornmeal, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and salt.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or deep fryer to 350°F.
Remove the shrimp from the marinade and shake off any excess. Dredge each shrimp in the flour-cornmeal mixture, making sure they are evenly coated.
Carefully place the coated shrimp into the hot oil and fry for about 2 minutes or until they turn golden brown and crispy. Fry the shrimp in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan.
Once the shrimp are cooked, remove them from the oil using a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
Prepare the sauce by combining the mayonnaise, garlic powder, honey, lemon zest, and lemon juice in a small bowl. Mix until well combined.
To assemble the Shrimp Po' Boys, spread a generous amount of the sauce on the toasted French baguette rolls.
Top the sauce with chopped lettuce.
Arrange the fried shrimp on top of the lettuce, and then close the sandwich with the top half of the baguette.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Shrimp Po' Boy
Description: A Shrimp Po' Boy is a classic and flavorful sandwich originating from Louisiana, USA. It typically consists of succulent, marinated shrimp that are coated in a seasoned flour-cornmeal dredge and fried until crispy. The shrimp are then served on a toasted French baguette roll, spread with a zesty sauce made with mayonnaise, honey, lemon zest, and lemon juice. The sandwich is topped with chopped lettuce, adding a refreshing crunch to complement the crispy shrimp. The combination of the spicy, tangy, and savory flavors makes the Shrimp Po' Boy a delightful and satisfying treat. It's a beloved dish that celebrates the rich culinary traditions of the Southern United States.

ingredients.Name: chicken, bones in, cleaned and pat dried
chili flakes (adjust to your preferred spice level)
Fresh green onions, thinly sliced (for garnish)

directions.Direction: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced ginger, shallots, green onions, and crushed star anise. Sauté the mixture for 2-3 minutes until the aromatics release their flavors and become fragrant.
Pour in the rice wine and let it simmer for a minute to cook off the alcohol.
Add the soy sauce and chili flakes to the pot and stir well to combine. Allow the mixture to come to a gentle boil.
Carefully place the dried whole chicken into the pot, ensuring it is fully submerged in the soy sauce mixture. If needed, add more water until the chicken is covered.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot with a lid, and let the chicken simmer for 15 minutes.
After 15 minutes, carefully flip the chicken over using tongs or large spoons. Simmer for an additional 15 minutes, covered.
Check the chicken for doneness by piercing the thickest part of the meat with a knife. If the juices run clear, and the internal temperature reaches 165°F, the chicken is cooked.
Remove the cooked chicken from the pot and transfer it to a cutting board. Let it rest for a few minutes before carving.
While the chicken rests, increase the heat to medium-high and bring the soy sauce mixture to a rapid boil. Let it reduce for a few minutes until slightly thickened and flavorful.
Carve the soy sauce chicken into desired pieces and serve it over steamed rice. Drizzle some of the reduced soy sauce mixture over the chicken pieces.
Garnish with freshly sliced green onions and serve hot.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Soy Sauce Chicken
Description: Soy Sauce Chicken is a savory and succulent dish that features a whole chicken with bones, simmered in a flavorful mixture of soy sauce, aromatic spices, and chili flakes. The chicken is cooked until tender, absorbing the rich umami flavors from the soy sauce and the fragrant essence of ginger, shallots, green onions, and star anise. The result is a mouthwatering, juicy chicken with a subtle hint of spiciness. The sauce is reduced to a thick glaze, adding depth and intensity to the dish. This comforting and delightful meal is often served over steamed rice, making it a perfect balance of flavors and textures. With its inviting aroma and wholesome taste, soy sauce chicken is a classic Asian dish that satisfies both the eyes and the palate.

ingredients.Name: For the Quick Pickled Flame Grilled Jalapeno and Chili Peppers:
For the Quick Pickled Red Onions:
Shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or a blend)
Your blended pickled onions and peppers with roasted garlic
Small corn tortillas, cut into quarters

directions.Direction: Roasted Garlic: Preheat your oven to 400°F. Peel away the outer layers of the garlic bulb skin, leaving the individual cloves intact. Cut about 1/4 inch off the top of the garlic bulb, exposing the tops of the cloves. Drizzle olive oil over the exposed surface, letting it sink down into the cloves. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Wrap the garlic bulb in aluminum foil and place it on a baking sheet. Roast in the oven for about 30-35 minutes or until the cloves are soft and lightly browned. Allow it to cool.

Quick Pickled Flame Grilled Jalapeno and Chili Peppers: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Grill the jalapeno and chili peppers until they are slightly charred on all sides. In a saucepan, combine the white vinegar, water, sugar, and salt. Bring to a boil and stir until the sugar and salt dissolve. Place the grilled peppers in a clean glass jar or container and pour the pickling liquid over them. Allow the pickled peppers to cool, then cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before using.

Quick Pickled Red Onions: In a saucepan, combine the apple cider vinegar, water, sugar, and salt. Bring to a boil and stir until the sugar and salt dissolve. Add the thinly sliced red onions to the pickling liquid and turn off the heat. Let the onions sit in the pickling liquid for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Hot Cheeto Seasoning: Crush the Hot Cheetos into a fine powder using a food processor or a sealed plastic bag and a rolling pin. In a small bowl, mix the crushed Hot Cheetos with chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Dip: In a bowl, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, lime zest, lime juice, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Cooking the Beef: Cook the ground beef on medium heat until brown and cooked through. Season with chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

Chips: In a deep skillet or pot, heat enough vegetable oil to submerge the tortilla quarters over medium-high heat. Fry the tortilla quarters in batches until they are golden and crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. While the chips are still hot, toss them in the prepared Hot Cheeto seasoning until evenly coated.

Blended Pickle Mixture: In a blender or with an immersion blender, combine the pickled flame-grilled jalapeno and chili peppers with the pickled red onions and roasted garlic. Blend until you have a smooth liquid mixture.

Assembling the Taco in a Bag: Take a handful of the Hot Cheeto-seasoned chips and place them in a large paper bag or a bowl. Add a spoonful of each ground beef and sausage mixture over the chips. Drizzle with the blended pickle mixture and top with diced fresh tomatoes, shredded lettuce, and shredded cheese. Serve with the prepared dip on the side.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Taco in a Bag
Description:
The homemade Taco in a Bag is a mouthwatering and flavorful delight that combines various delicious elements into one satisfying meal.

Picture a paper bag filled with a bed of crunchy, golden-brown corn tortilla chips. These chips are not your ordinary chips; they are coated with a fiery and zesty Hot Cheeto seasoning that adds a spicy kick to every bite. The seasoning brings a tantalizing mix of chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, and cumin, creating a taste explosion that lingers on the palate.

ingredients.Name: steak cuts (such as ribeye, sirloin, or filet mignon), about 1 thick
of Papa John's Garlic Butter Sauce (available from your local Papa John's restaurant)
vegetable oil or any high heat cooking oil

directions.Direction: Prepare the Steaks: Take the steaks out of the refrigerator and let them sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes before cooking. This helps them cook more evenly. Season both sides of the steaks generously with salt and pepper. Let the seasoning sit on the steaks for at least 15 minutes to enhance flavor.

Microwave the Garlic Butter Sauce: Empty the contents of all 50 Papa John's Garlic Butter Sauce packets into a large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave the sauce on high for 1-2 minutes until it becomes a liquid consistency. Stir the sauce to ensure it's evenly heated.

Poach the Steaks: Preheat your oven to 125°F (52°C), the ideal temperature for poaching steaks. Place the seasoned steaks into a shallow baking dish that can comfortably fit all of them. Carefully pour the warmed garlic butter sauce over the steaks until they are fully submerged in the liquid. Cover the dish with aluminum foil, creating a tight seal.

Poaching Time: Place the covered dish in the preheated oven and poach the steaks for about 1 to 1.5 hours. Cooking times may vary depending on your desired level of doneness and the thickness of the steaks. Use a meat thermometer to check the internal temperature of the steaks. For medium-rare, the temperature should read around 130°F (54°C), for medium around 140°F (60°C), and for medium-well around 150°F (65°C).

Sear the Steaks: Once the steaks have finished poaching, remove them from the garlic butter sauce and pat them dry with paper towels. In a large skillet or grill pan, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over high heat until it starts to shimmer. Sear the steaks on each side for 1-2 minutes until you achieve a beautiful crust. This will add a delicious sear and enhance the flavor.
Serve: Once the steaks are nicely seared, transfer them to a cutting board and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Papa John's Garlic Sauce Steak
Description: The Papa John's Garlic Butter Sauce is a luscious and velvety sauce with a distinct buttery taste and a hint of garlic. Its consistency is more akin to a smooth, rich oil, making it perfect for coating the steaks and infusing them with a delightful, buttery flavor. The garlic undertones add a savory and aromatic dimension to the sauce, elevating the overall taste of the steaks.

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Season the chicken breasts: In a small bowl, mix together garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle the seasoning evenly over both sides of the chicken breasts.
Flatten the chicken breasts: Place each seasoned chicken breast between two sheets of plastic wrap and gently pound them with a meat mallet or rolling pin until they are about 1/4 inch (6mm) thick.

Assemble the Wellingtons: Lay out one sheet of puff pastry on a lightly floured surface. Spread a thin layer of Dijon mustard over the pastry. Next, place two slices of Swiss cheese on the pastry, leaving some space around the edges. Lay a flattened chicken breast on top of the cheese, followed by two slices of ham and another two slices of Swiss cheese.
Roll it up: Carefully roll the pastry, enclosing the chicken, ham, and cheese tightly. Seal the edges by pressing them together. Repeat the process for the other chicken breasts.

Brush with egg wash: Place the chicken Wellingtons on the prepared baking sheet, seam side down. Brush the tops and sides of the Wellingtons with the beaten egg wash, which will give them a beautiful golden color when baked.

Bake: Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 40-50 minutes or until the Wellingtons are golden brown and the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F when measured with a meat thermometer.

Serve: Once done, remove the Chicken Cordon Bleu Wellingtons from the oven and let them rest for a couple of minutes before serving. Slice each Wellington into thick, appetizing portions and enjoy the delectable flavors!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Cordon Bleu Wellington
Description: Chicken Cordon Bleu Wellington is a delightful twist on the classic Chicken Cordon Bleu, combining the flavors of tender chicken, savory ham, and creamy Swiss cheese in a flaky puff pastry. This dish is perfect for a special occasion or a gourmet dinner at home. The combination of the seasoned chicken breast, Swiss cheese, and ham, all encased in a golden puff pastry, creates a mouthwatering experience that will impress your guests.

directions.Direction: In a large pan, render the diced bacon over medium heat until it becomes crispy and releases its fat. This will take about 8-10 minutes. Once the bacon is cooked, remove it from the pan and strain it to drain excess fat. Save the bacon fat in a separate container; you'll need it again.

In the same pan, add the butter, bacon fat, and chopped onions. Cook the onions over medium heat until they become soft and translucent, stirring occasionally. This will take approximately 5-7 minutes.
Pour in the red wine vinegar and continue cooking for another 2 minutes, allowing the vinegar to infuse with the onions.
Add the brown sugar to the pan and stir until it dissolves completely.
Return the cooked bacon to the pan with the onions and mix everything together.
Pour in the water and bring the mixture to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 30 minutes or until the liquid thickens and becomes syrupy. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.
While the bacon jam is simmering, prepare the sandwiches. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on one side of each bread slice.
Take another clean pan and place it over medium-low heat. You can also use a griddle if you have one.

Assemble the sandwiches: On the non-mayo side of four bread slices, spread a generous amount of the homemade bacon jam. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheddar cheese mix over the jam, and then top each with the remaining four bread slices, mayo side up.
Carefully transfer the assembled sandwiches to the heated pan or griddle. Cook each side for 3-4 minutes or until the bread turns golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Once the sandwiches are done, remove them from the pan and let them cool for a minute or two.
Cut the grilled cheese sandwiches in half and serve them warm. Enjoy the gooey goodness of the bacon jam and cheese combination!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Bacon Jam Grilled Cheese
Description: This Homemade Bacon Jam Grilled Cheese is the tastiest grilled cheese ever. The rich and smoky bacon jam pairs perfectly with the creamy mozzarella cheddar cheese, all enveloped between crispy, buttery slices of bread. The sweet and savory flavors of the bacon jam will tantalize your taste buds, making this a grilled cheese sandwich like no other.

directions.Direction: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking powder, glutinous rice flour, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the plain yogurt, egg, and water until well combined.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until a dough forms. The dough should be slightly sticky.
Cover the dough with plastic wrap and let it rest for about 15-20 minutes.
On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough into a log shape and cut it into 12 equal pieces.
Take each piece and roll it into a smooth ball. Using your thumb, make a hole in the center of each ball, creating a donut shape. Ensure the donut ball ring is even in thickness.
In a large pot or deep-fryer, heat vegetable oil to 350°F.
Carefully drop a few donuts into the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove the fried donuts from the oil using a slotted spoon and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.

Maple Glaze Topping: In a small bowl, mix powdered sugar and water until you get a smooth glaze with the desired consistency. Drizzle maple syrup over the glaze and stir it in for extra sweetness. Dip the fried mochi donuts into the glaze to coat the top side. Sprinkle crumbled bacon over the glaze while it's still wet.

White Chocolate and Oreo Topping: Melt the white chocolate in a microwave or using a double boiler until it's smooth and creamy. Dip the top side of the fried mochi donuts into the melted white chocolate to coat them. Sprinkle crushed Oreos over the melted white chocolate before it sets.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Mochi Donuts
Description: Mochi donuts are a delightful and innovative twist on traditional donuts, combining the irresistibly chewy texture of Japanese mochi with the familiar shape of a classic donut. These delectable treats boast a unique blend of flavors and textures, making them a delightful surprise for the taste buds.

ingredients.Name: boiled pork, preferably shoulder or loin, cut into thin strips
cayenne pepper (adjust to your spice preference)
pork broth (reserved from boiling the pork)

directions.Direction: In a large pot, add the boiled pork, garlic, sweet onion, peppercorns, ginger paste, and salt. Cover the ingredients with enough water to fully submerge them. Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat.

Reduce the heat to low and let the pork simmer for about 2 hours or until it becomes tender and can be easily peeled into thin strips. The low simmering ensures the pork becomes soft and fibrous for shredding.

Once the pork is tender, remove it from the pot and let it cool slightly. Then, use your fingers or a fork to shred the pork into thin strips. Make sure to remove any excess fat or tough parts while shredding.
In a separate bowl, prepare the sauce by mixing together sugar, MSG (if using), cayenne pepper, vinegar, soy sauce, and pork broth. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved.
Heat a large pan or wok over low heat and add the shredded pork to it. Pour the sauce over the pork and stir continuously to coat the pork evenly with the sauce.

Keep stirring the pork over low heat until it absorbs most of the sauce and the texture becomes soft and fluffy. This process may take around 15-20 minutes. Be patient and ensure the heat is not too high to avoid burning.
Once the pork floss reaches the desired consistency, turn off the heat, and let it cool down. The pork floss will continue to dry and become fluffier as it cools.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Pork Floss
Description: Pork floss, also known as "rousong" or "yuk sung," is a savory and flavorful shredded pork delicacy with a light, fluffy texture. This recipe uses boiled pork cooked in a seasoned water infused with garlic, sweet onion, peppercorns, ginger paste, and salt. The slow cooking process allows the pork to become tender, enabling easy shredding into delicate strips.

directions.Direction: Prepare the hot dogs and mozzarella: Cut each hot dog in half lengthwise. Make a cross-shaped cut at the end of each hot dog, about half an inch down. This will create the appearance of "squid legs." Slice the mozzarella cheese into chunks that are roughly the same thickness and length as the hot dog halves. Slightly thicker and longer pieces work best.
Skewering the hot dogs and cheese: Skewer each hot dog and mozzarella slice onto a stick, making sure the cut split end of the hot dog is facing away from the cheese.

Making the batter: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder. In a separate bowl, beat the egg, then add the milk whisking until well combined. Gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, stirring until you have a smooth batter. Finally, add the squid ink and mix until an even color and texture.

Coating the corndogs: Pour the batter into a tall glass for easy dipping. Dip each hot dog and mozzarella skewer into the batter, making sure to coat the entire surface, leaving the split ends of the hot dog untouched.
Coating with panko crumbs: Roll the battered hot dog and cheese in the panko breadcrumbs until they are evenly coated.

Frying the Squid Ink Corndogs: In a deep, heavy-bottomed pot or deep fryer, heat vegetable oil to 350°F (175°C). Carefully lower the coated corndogs into the hot oil, cooking in batches to avoid overcrowding the fryer. Fry the Squid Ink Corndogs for about 3-4 minutes, or until they turn golden brown and the hot dogs are cooked through.
Serving: Remove the corndogs from the hot oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb any excess oil.
Serve the Squid Ink Corndogs warm with your favorite dipping sauce. Enjoy the delightful combination of flavors and the fun, squid-like appearance of the curled hot dog legs!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Squid Ink Corndog
Description: These Squid Ink Corndogs make for a unique and visually appealing treat that will surprise and delight your guests. The addition of squid ink gives the batter a striking dark color, making them stand out at any party or gathering. Serve them up for a creative twist on the classic corndog that will leave everyone impressed!

ingredients.Name: jumbo hot dogs (spicy hot dogs preferred)
Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce (or your preferred BBQ sauce)

directions.Direction: Prepare the Weenies: Take each jumbo hot dog and cut it into thirds. Using a straw or a small corer, carefully core out the center of each hot dog piece to create a cavity for the filling. Be gentle not to puncture the sides of the hot dogs.
Make the Filling: In a food processor, combine the finely diced jalapenos, crumbled crispy bacon, and softened cream cheese. Blend until well-mixed and smooth.

Fill the Weenies: Transfer the cream cheese filling into a piping bag or a zip-lock bag with a corner snipped off. Carefully pipe the filling into the cavities of each hot dog piece, ensuring they are evenly filled.
Seal the Weenies: Take the Panko breadcrumbs and generously coat each end of the stuffed hot dog pieces to prevent any filling from spilling out during cooking.

Smoke the Weenies: Preheat your smoker to 180°F. Place the stuffed and breadcrumb-coated hot dog pieces onto the smoker rack. Smoke the weenies for about 1 hour, allowing the flavors to meld and the hot dogs to absorb the smoky goodness.

BBQ Glaze: After the hour is up, remove the weenies from the smoker. Coat each weenie liberally with Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce or your preferred BBQ sauce. You can brush it on or dip the weenies into the sauce.
Finish Cooking: Return the glazed weenies to the smoker and continue cooking for an additional 30 minutes, allowing the BBQ sauce to caramelize and create a delicious sticky glaze.
Serve and Enjoy: Once the cooking is complete, remove the weenies from the smoker.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Creamy Weenie
Description: These creamy stuffed weenies combine the smoky heat of spicy hot dogs, the richness of cream cheese filling, the kick from jalapenos, and the savory crunch of bacon and Panko breadcrumbs. They make for a delicious appetizer or a unique twist on traditional hot dogs for any gathering or barbecue event. Enjoy the flavor explosion!

ingredients.Name: smoked onion French onion soup (or store bought alternative)

directions.Direction: Prepare the Rice: In an Instant Pot, combine the washed jasmine rice, smoked onion French onion soup, and butter. Close the lid and set the Instant Pot to cook on the rice setting (or manual mode) for the appropriate cooking time for jasmine rice. Once cooked, fluff the rice with a fork and let it cool slightly.
Assemble the Wontons: Take a wonton wrapper and place a spoonful of the cooked rice mixture into the center. Add a small amount (about a teaspoon) of grated Gruyere cheese on top of the rice.

Seal the Wontons: Dip your finger in water and wet the edges of the wonton wrapper to help seal it. Fold the wonton diagonally to form a triangle, enclosing the filling. Press the edges firmly to seal the wonton shut, ensuring no air pockets are left inside.

Deep Fry the Wontons: Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or a deep, heavy-bottomed pot to 375°F. Carefully drop the wontons into the hot oil in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the fryer or pot. Fry the wontons for about 2-3 minutes or until they turn golden brown and crispy. Use a slotted spoon to remove the fried wontons and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
Serve and Enjoy: Serve the French Onion Rice Wontons hot as they are or with a dipping sauce of your choice, such as a sweet chili sauce or soy sauce with a dash of sesame oil.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: French Onion Rice Wontons
Description: French Onion Rice Wontons are a delightful fusion of classic French onion soup flavors and crispy Asian-inspired wontons. These savory bites are filled with a luscious combination of jasmine rice, smoked onion French onion soup, and melted Gruyere cheese. The instant pot makes cooking the rice quick and easy, while deep frying the wontons adds a crispy, golden exterior. These tasty treats are perfect as appetizers or party snacks, sure to impress your guests with their unique and delicious flavors.

ingredients.Name: Buldak hot sauce (or any other spicy hot sauce of your choice)
beer (pale ale or lager works well)

directions.Direction: Prepare the Eggs: Using a sharp knife, score the pre-peeled eggs all around their surface, creating a crisscross pattern. This will help the sauce penetrate into the eggs and give them their "tiger skin" appearance.

Deep Fry the Eggs: In a deep frying pan or pot, heat enough vegetable oil to submerge the eggs. Once the oil is hot (around 350°F), carefully place the scored eggs into the hot oil. Fry the eggs until they turn golden brown and the scoring lines become dark and visible. This should take approximately 3-4 minutes. Once done, remove the eggs from the oil and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.

Prepare the Spicy Sauce: In a separate hot pan or wok, add the sugar and let it caramelize over medium-high heat. Stir occasionally to avoid burning. Once the sugar has melted and turned a golden brown color, add the honey, soy sauce, and Buldak hot sauce. Mix everything together until well combined.

Coat the Eggs: Pour the beer into the pan with the spicy sauce mixture and let it cook for a few seconds to incorporate. Add the deep-fried eggs to the pan, gently stirring them in the sauce until they are thoroughly coated. Continue stirring until the sauce thickens and becomes sticky, adhering to the eggs. This should take about 2-3 minutes.
Serve and Garnish: Transfer the spicy tiger skin pickled eggs to a serving plate. Sprinkle the chopped onions over the top as a garnish. The pickled eggs are now ready to be enjoyed!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Tiger Skin Pickled Eggs
Description: Tiger Skin Pickled Eggs are a delightful and visually striking twist on traditional pickled eggs. The name is derived from the marbled appearance of the eggs, resembling the unique patterns found on a tiger's skin. These eggs make a fantastic appetizer or a flavorful addition to salads and sandwiches. The pre-pickled eggs add convenience and save time, making this recipe a breeze to prepare. Get ready to impress your guests with these vibrant and flavorful eggs!

ingredients.Name: cooked and shredded chicken (rotisserie or boiled)

directions.Direction: Prepare the Chicken: Cook the chicken thoroughly and shred it into small pieces. You can use rotisserie chicken or boiled chicken breasts.
Preheat Waffle Iron: Preheat your waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions.

Mix the Batter: In a mixing bowl, combine the store-bought pancake mix, water, vegetable oil, baking powder, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, and paprika. Stir until well combined, but avoid overmixing; some lumps are okay.

Make Waffle Lollipops: Grease the preheated waffle iron with non-stick cooking spray. Place a small amount of the batter onto the center of the waffle iron. Add a spoonful of shredded chicken on top of the batter. Cover the chicken with a little more batter to encase it fully. Insert a wooden lollipop stick or skewer into the middle of the waffle, making sure it is securely held by the batter.

Cook the Lollipops: Close the waffle iron and cook until the waffle is golden brown and cooked through. Cooking times may vary based on your waffle iron, but it usually takes 2-3 minutes. Carefully remove the waffle lollipops from the iron and place them on a wire rack to cool slightly. Repeat the process for the remaining batter and chicken.
Serve: Once the waffle lollipops have cooled slightly, you can serve them with a small bowl of warm maple syrup for dipping.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Chicken and Waffle Lollipops
Description: Indulge in a delightful fusion of flavors with these irresistible Chicken and Waffle Lollipops. Imagine tender shredded chicken, carefully nestled between fluffy waffle batter, all served on a convenient lollipop stick. This playful twist on a classic southern dish is sure to delight both kids and adults alike.

ingredients.Name: large soft baguettes or Korean milk bread rolls

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 400°F
Prepare the garlic butter: In a mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, roasted garlic, and chopped parsley. Mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
Cut the rolls or baguettes: Slice the rolls or baguettes into quarters, but not all the way through, leaving the quarters attached at the bottom.
Stuff the bread: Generously spread the garlic butter mixture inside each slice of bread, making sure to get the mixture in between the slices. Stuff the bread with the warm cream cheese.

Make the glaze: In a small saucepan, melt the butter over low heat. Add the condensed milk, honey, and soy sauce. Stir well and let it simmer for a minute until the glaze is well combined and slightly thickened.
Bake the garlic bread: Place the stuffed bread on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until the bread turns golden brown.
Add More Garlic Butter: Heat and pour on more garlic butter until the bread is fully coated.
Serve hot: Remove the Korean Garlic Bread from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Korean Garlic Bread
Description: Korean cream cheese garlic bread is a popular Korean street food featuring a twist on classic garlic bread. Medium size rolls cut into wedges. Then filled with sweetened cream cheese and dunked in garlic butter.

directions.Direction: Prepare your veggies. Dice carrots, dice onion, dice pickles, and peel and chop potatoes.

Chop your bacon and add to a cold frying pan. Bring the pan up to heat until the bacon is cooked to your desired doneness(I cooked until slightly crispy.) Remove your bacon bits from the pan and pour the fat into a large soup pot.
Add diced onion to the pot and cook in the bacon fat until translucent and fragrant.

Combine chicken broth, pickle juice, diced pickles, diced carrots, chopped potatoes, and butter in the pot. Bring to a boil and cook until the potatoes are tender. Once tender, turn the pot to low so it simmers.
In a medium bowl, stir together flour, sour cream and water. Whisk sour cream mixture into soup. (You might see some little balls of flour, but with the whisking it all will disappear. Don't worry.)
Add Old Bay, salt, and pepper to taste. Cook 5 more minutes and remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: The VIRAL Dill Pickle Soup
Description: This Dill Pickle Soup is one of the best-tasting soups you’ll ever have. Especially if you're a massive pickle lover like me! If you’re not a pickle lover, this soup might be the dish that finally changes your mind.

directions.Direction: Assuming your turkey is thawed out. Take your knife and cut between the breasts along the bone. Carefully carve downwards keeping your knife along the bone. When you reach the leg and wing bones, cut between the joints that are attached to the back. Now, carefully carve along the spine. This is where it's easiest to puncture the skin but if you keep your knife hugged against the spine you'll have no problems. Now carve the meat around the femur (Top Leg bone) and the Humerus (Wing Drum) and remove those bones leaving the others intact. Save the bones for soup.

Take your softened butter (not melted) and mix it together with Dijon Mustard, Chopped Parsley, Lemon Juice, Minced Garlic, Paprika, Salt, Pepper, Cayenne Pepper, and Crushed Red Pepper. Make sure it's mixed well. (This is a suggestion, you can use any flavors you like for your compound butter.)
Press your compound butter into the opened turkey body, covering all the meat.
Fold in each side of the turkey into itself, closing up the meat and butter. Then take butcher twine (100% cotton string) and tie up the bird. I used about 6 loops to keep things uniform and shut.

Season the outside with 3 tbsp Kosher Salt (use more if needed) and 1 1/2 tbsp black pepper. Season all sides of the turkey then place in the fridge on a sheet pan with a rack so air can circulate around the turkey. Leave it uncovered in your fridge overnight.

Cook in a 250°F Smoker or a 350°f oven until the temperature reaches 165°F (4-5 hours on the smoker and 2-3 in the oven) in the thickest part of the meat. Let the turkey rest for 30 minutes before carving into it. This will allow for all those juices to cool down and not pour out everywhere. Serve and enjoy.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Thanksgiving Turkey (semi-boneless)
Description:
Turkey has a poor breast-to-leg ratio so by the time you get the leg meat safe to eat, the breast meat has dried out. This method results in a more even cook resulting in a juicier, more flavorful turkey. 

And all you need to do is remove some of the bones.

directions.Direction: Hard boil your eggs. TIP: Place eggs in rapid boiling water for 8-9 minutes, then immediately transfer to iced water. This will make for easy peeling)
Cut your eggs in half, removing the yolks. Set your egg white halves aside.
Mix your yolks until smooth with mayo, ground rosemary, cranberry sauce, & salt and pepper.
Spoon or pipe your yolk filling into your egg white halves. Top with left over turkey, stuffing, and gravy.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Leftover Thanksgiving Deviled Eggs (EASY)
Description: Arguably, the leftovers from Thanksgiving are better than the actual meal itself, and what better way to use up leftovers than combining them with everybody's favorite? The Deviled Egg.

ingredients.Name: (250 ml) Can of French Onion soup
Gruyere cheese slices (Subtitute with Swiss if needed)

directions.Direction: Heat 1 can of French onion soup and mix in your gelatin until fully dissolved (3 Minutes).
Pour your soup onto a flat tray and let it cool in the fridge until solidified.

Cut French onion soup and cheese slices into circles. Note: Make sure the French onion soup circles are smaller than your cheese circles and make sure your cheese circles are smaller than your uncrustable cutter.
On a piece of bread, layer your cheese and soup. Make sure the French onion soup is in between the cheese. Top with another piece of bread.
Take a small bowl or uncrustable cutter and cut out and pinch shut your sandwich.
In a pan, melt butter and fry both sides of your sandwich until golden brown.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: French Onion Soup Uncrustable
Description: Everything you love about French Onion Soup inside an uncrustable.
