directions.Direction: Heat 1 can of tomato soup and mix in your gelatin until fully dissolved (3 Minutes).
Pour your soup onto a flat tray and let it cool in the fridge until solidified.

Cut tomato soup and cheese slices into circles. Note: Make sure the tomato soup circles are smaller than your cheese circles and make sure your cheese circles are smaller than your uncrustable cutter.
On a piece of bread, layer your cheese and tomato soup. Make sure the tomato soup is in between the cheese. Top with another piece of bread.
Take a small bowl or uncrustable cutter and cut out and pinch shut your sandwich.
In a pan, melt butter and fry both sides of your sandwich until golden brown.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Tomato Soup Uncrustable
Description: Tomato soup and grilled cheese are a match made in heaven. This recipe combines both into a delicious pocket of cheesy tomato soup.

ingredients.Name: For the Smoked Pulled Pork Recipe:
Pulled Pork (prepared using the smoked pulled pork recipe)

directions.Direction: For the Smoked Pulled Pork:

Preparation: Trim the skin off the majority of the pork picnic shoulder, leaving the elbow section with skin for aesthetics. Rub the pork shoulder with a thin layer of mustard as a binder, then coat it with BBQ seasoning.
Preheat your smoker to 250°F (121°C). Insert the Thermopro Twin Tempspike thermometer to monitor the internal temperature.
Place the seasoned pork shoulder in the smoker and smoke it until the internal temperature reaches 165°-175°F (74°-79°C). This might take around 8-10 hours depending on the size of the shoulder.
Once the pork reaches the desired internal temperature, wrap it in butcher paper or foil to help retain moisture. Place it back in the smoker.
Continue smoking until the internal temperature of the pork reaches 200°-203°F (93°-95°C). This could take an additional 4-6 hours.

After reaching the target temperature, remove the wrapped pork from the smoker and let it rest in a cooler or turned-off oven for a minimum of 2 hours. You mentioned you let it rest overnight, which can enhance the tenderness.
Unwrap the rested pork, shred it, and pour in the juices from the foil. Add BBQ sauce if desired, and mix well.
For the Enchiladas:
Take medium-sized flour tortillas and layer them with pulled pork, black beans, and shredded cheese.
Roll up the tortillas, enclosing the filling tightly.
Place the rolled tortillas in a baking dish, seam side down, to prevent them from unrolling.
Pour both red and green enchilada sauces over the rolled tortillas, ensuring they are well covered. Sprinkle additional shredded cheese on top.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and bake the enchiladas until they are warmed throughout and the cheese is melted and bubbly. This might take around 20-25 minutes.

Once baked, remove the enchiladas from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving. They can be served with additional toppings like sour cream, chopped cilantro, or sliced jalapeños if desired.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Pulled Pork Enchilladas
Description: This meal combines the rich, smoky flavors of slow-smoked pulled pork with the comforting warmth of enchiladas. The smoked pulled pork, tender and infused with smokiness, forms the hearty core of the enchiladas. The tortillas are filled with a blend of succulent pulled pork, earthy black beans, and creamy cheese, then rolled and nestled in a baking dish. Topped with both red and green enchilada sauces and a layer of melted cheese, the enchiladas are baked to perfection, resulting in a fusion of flavors that is both satisfying and delightful.

directions.Direction: For the Beef Rib:
Preheat your smoker to 250°F (120°C).
Season the slab of short ribs with salt and pepper, ensuring even coverage.
Place the ribs in the smoker and let them cook until they reach an internal temperature of 180°F (82°C).
Wrap the smoked short ribs in tallow, butter, or oil, then wrap them tightly in butcher paper or aluminum foil.
Continue smoking until the ribs reach an internal temperature of 200°F (93°C).
Remove the ribs from the smoker and let them rest for a bit before shredding the meat.
For the Cheese Sauce:
Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Sprinkle in the all-purpose flour and whisk continuously to form a smooth roux. Cook for a couple of minutes, but do not let it brown.
Gradually pour in about 2 cups of the half and half while whisking constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
Add the remaining half and half and the whole milk, and continue whisking until the mixture is well combined and smooth.
Let the mixture simmer gently for a few minutes, allowing it to thicken.
Reduce the heat to low and start adding the shredded cheddar and Gruyere cheeses gradually, stirring constantly until all the cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy.
Season the sauce with salt and black pepper, adjusting the amounts to taste.
For the Assembling the Beef-Stuffed Mac and Cheese:
Cook the pasta shells according to the package instructions until they are al dente. Drain and set aside.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Take each cooked pasta shell and stuff it generously with the smoked and shredded short rib meat.
Arrange the stuffed shells in a baking dish in a single layer.
Pour the prepared cheese sauce over the stuffed shells, ensuring they are evenly covered. Add additional shredded cheese and sliced jalapenos.
Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden on top.
Once done, remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Beef Stuffed Mac and Cheese
Description: This indulgent dish combines the rich flavors of smoked and shredded short ribs with creamy cheese sauce, all enveloped in tender pasta shells. The process involves seasoning and smoking the short ribs to tender perfection, shredding the meat, and stuffing it into cooked pasta shells. A luscious cheese sauce, made with a blend of cheddar and Gruyere cheeses, adds a velvety finish. The stuffed shells are then baked until the cheese is bubbly and golden, creating a harmonious fusion of smoky, meaty, and cheesy goodness.

ingredients.Name: Sweet Baby Ray's Original BBQ Sauce

directions.Direction: Pre-heat your smoker to 250°F (121°C).
Carefully core and seed the jalapeños. Wear gloves to protect your hands from the heat.
Clean the prawns, leaving the tails intact. Make a small slit down the back to remove the vein. Pat them dry with paper towels.
Insert each prawn into a cored jalapeño, ensuring the tail end remains exposed.
Take a handful of chorizo sausage and flatten it into a thin layer. Wrap the sausage around the jalapeño, covering it completely while keeping the prawn tail exposed.
Wrap each chorizo-covered jalapeño with 2-3 slices of thin bacon. Use toothpicks to secure the bacon ends if necessary. Season the bacon-wrapped jalapeños with your favorite low-sodium BBQ seasoning.
Place the prepared jalapeños on the smoker grate, making sure they are not touching each other. Close the smoker lid.
Smoke the stuffed jalapeños at 250°F for about 2 hours. The bacon should become crispy and the chorizo should be cooked through.

Around the halfway mark (1 hour into the cooking process), open the smoker and carefully brush on a layer of Sweet Baby Ray's Original BBQ Sauce onto each stuffed jalapeño. This will add flavor and moisture to the dish.
Close the smoker and continue cooking for the remaining hour, or until the bacon is fully cooked and the internal temperature of the prawns reaches 145°F (63°C).
Once done, carefully remove the stuffed jalapeños from the smoker using grill tongs. Allow them to cool slightly before serving.

Serve the stuffed jalapeños as a delicious and flavorful appetizer. The combination of the smoky bacon, spicy jalapeño, savory chorizo, and succulent prawn creates a mouthwatering treat that's perfect for sharing.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Shrimp Bombs
Description:

Indulge in a tantalizing appetizer with our Stuffed Jalapeños featuring a savory medley of flavors. Colossal prawns, nestled within cored jalapeños, are enveloped in a layer of spicy chorizo sausage. To elevate the experience, these bundles are swathed in crispy bacon, imbued with the rich aroma of a low-sodium BBQ rub. Slow-smoked to perfection, the dish reaches its crescendo as Sweet Baby Ray's Original BBQ Sauce is lovingly brushed on, infusing the ensemble with a touch of sweetness. Each bite offers a harmonious blend of heat, smokiness, and succulent textures—a true delight for your taste buds.

directions.Direction: Using a sharp chef's knife, butterfly open the slab of pork belly to increase the surface area.
In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of brown sugar and 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon to create the seasoning mixture.
Sprinkle the sugar-cinnamon mixture evenly over the butterflied pork belly.
Lightly season the pork belly with salt to balance the sweetness.
Roll the pork belly into a tight cylinder, securing the roll with cooking string along its length.
Evenly coat the tied pork belly roll with more of the sugar-cinnamon mixture, ensuring it's thoroughly covered.
Preheat your smoker or grill to 250°F (121°C).
Place the seasoned pork belly roll on the smoker rack.
Smoke the pork belly at 250°F for 4-5 hours, or until it reaches your desired level of tenderness and smokiness.
In a small saucepan, melt a generous amount of butter along with some brown sugar and maple syrup. Mix well to create a basting sauce.
After 4-5 hours of smoking, baste the smoked pork belly roll with the butter, brown sugar, and maple syrup mixture.
Return the basted pork belly to the smoker for an additional hour. This will help caramelize the basting mixture and enhance the flavors.
Once the pork belly is beautifully caramelized and tender, remove it from the smoker.
Carefully remove the cooking string and slice the roll into thick, flavorful pork belly cinnamon rolls.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Pork Belly Cinnamon Rolls
Description: This recipe offers a creative twist on the classic pork belly burnt ends, infusing them with the warmth of cinnamon and the sweetness of maple syrup. The smoking process imparts a smoky flavor that perfectly complements the sweet and savory profile of the dish.

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven or smoker to 300°F (150°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup.

Wash the jalapeño peppers and carefully cut off the tops. Use a small knife or a jalapeño corer to remove the seeds and membranes. Be cautious while handling the peppers, as the oils can irritate your skin. Set the prepared peppers aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese and crumbled feta cheese. Mix well until the mixture is creamy and well-blended. This tangy and savory filling will be the heart of your poppers.
Using a small spoon, fill each cored jalapeño pepper with the whipped feta mixture, pressing it gently to ensure they are filled evenly.
Take a slice of prosciutto and wrap it around each stuffed jalapeño pepper. The prosciutto adds a layer of saltiness and complements the creaminess of the filling.
Roll the open end of each stuffed pepper in bread crumbs. This step will help prevent the filling from spilling out during baking and also add a satisfying crunch to the poppers.

Place the coated and wrapped poppers on the prepared baking sheet. If using an oven, bake for approximately 60 minutes. If using a smoker, smoke for about 60 minutes. After the first 30 minutes, brush your favorite BBQ sauce onto the poppers. This will add a smoky and slightly sweet flavor to the poppers.

Once the poppers are cooked to a golden brown and the prosciutto is crispy, remove them from the oven or smoker. Allow them to cool slightly before serving. Arrange the poppers on a serving platter and provide extra BBQ sauce on the side for dipping.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Whipped Feta Jalapeno Poppers
Description: Whipped Feta Jalapeño Poppers are a delightful blend of spicy jalapeños, creamy feta and cream cheese, and savory prosciutto, all brought together with a touch of BBQ goodness. These poppers make for a fantastic appetizer or party snack, offering a combination of flavors and textures that will keep your guests coming back for more.

directions.Direction: Prepare the brine: In a large container or resealable plastic bag, combine water, salt, sugar, crushed garlic, and bay leaves. Stir well until the salt and sugar dissolve completely.

Prep the chicken: Remove the bones and skin from the chicken leaving the skin intact. Chop the chicken into small pieces, about 1-inch in size. Season the chopped chicken generously with your rub of choice.

Wrap the chicken in the skin: Take the seasoned chicken and wrap the skin around it, creating a neat package. Use butcher's twine to tie the wrapped chicken tightly, ensuring it holds its shape during cooking.
Brine the chicken: Place the tied chicken pieces in the brine, making sure they are fully submerged. Seal the container or bag and refrigerate overnight (at least 8 hours).
Remove from brine and pat dry: The next day, take the chicken out of the brine and pat it dry using paper towels. Discard the brine.
Season again: Season the chicken once more with your rub, adjusting the seasoning to your taste preferences.
For the Grill method
Preheat your grill to 205°C. Roast the chicken for about 50 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F when tested with a meat thermometer.
For the Air Fryer Method:

Preheat your air fryer to 205°C. Lightly brush the air fryer basket with olive oil to prevent sticking. Place the seasoned chicken in the air fryer basket, ensuring they are not touching each other to allow proper airflow.
Airfry the chicken for about 25-30 minutes, turning them halfway through for even cooking, or until the internal temperature reaches 75°C (75°C).
Serve and enjoy: Once cooked, let the chicken rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving. The crispy skin and tender, juicy meat will be a feast for your senses.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Juicy Boneless Chicken
Description: This delectable boneless chicken recipe takes chicken to a whole new level by removing the bones and skin, but keeping the skin intact to wrap around the seasoned, chopped chicken pieces. Brining the chicken with garlic and bay leaves adds a wonderful depth of flavor, making it moist and succulent. Once you take the first bite of this tender, juicy, and perfectly seasoned chicken, you'll be amazed by the explosion of flavors.

ingredients.Name: Salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
Your favorite dry rub or seasoning blend (adjust quantity to taste)

directions.Direction: Begin by trimming excess fat from the veal brisket points, leaving a thin layer for flavor and moisture.
Brush a thin layer of mustard over the surface of the brisket to act as a binder for the seasoning.
Mix the dry rub or seasoning blend with a small amount of salt and pepper to create a flavorful seasoning mix.
Place the two veal brisket points side by side, slightly overlapping.
Carefully roll the brisket points together to create a compact, cylindrical shape.
Use kitchen twine to tie the rolled brisket securely, ensuring it holds its shape during smoking.
Melt the tallow until it's in liquid form but not too hot.
Fill a food injector with the melted tallow.
Inject the tallow evenly into various parts of the rolled brisket to ensure moisture and flavor retention.
Preheat your smoker to 225°F (107°C).
Place the prepared veal brisket onto the smoker grate.
Smoke the brisket at 225°F until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C). This slow smoking process allows the meat to absorb the smoky flavors.
Remove the brisket from the smoker and place it on a sheet of butchers paper.
Brush an additional layer of melted tallow over the surface of the brisket.
Wrap the brisket tightly in the butchers paper to help retain moisture.

Return the wrapped brisket to the smoker and continue cooking until it reaches an internal temperature of 195°F (90.5°C). This higher temperature ensures the meat becomes tender and easily pull-apart.
Once the desired internal temperature is reached, remove the brisket from the smoker.
Allow the brisket to rest in the wrapped paper for about 30 minutes. This rest period helps redistribute the juices and ensures a tender result.
Carefully remove the twine and unwrap the butchers paper.
Slice the veal brisket against the grain into thin, mouthwatering pieces.
Serve the smoked veal brisket slices with your favorite barbecue sauce, coleslaw, or other side dishes of your choice.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Veal Brisket
Description: Indulge in the rich and succulent flavors of this smoked veal brisket, meticulously prepared to ensure a tender and mouthwatering experience. Two veal brisket points are expertly rolled and tied together, and then infused with tallow to maintain their juiciness throughout the smoking process. The meat undergoes a slow smoke at 225°F until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F, absorbing the smoky goodness. To enhance the flavor and texture, the brisket is wrapped in butchers paper with an extra dose of tallow and allowed to cook until it reaches an internal temperature of 195°F. The result is a perfectly smoked veal brisket with a deliciously flavorful crust and tender, melt-in-your-mouth interior. Mustard is used as a binder to ensure the seasoning adheres to the meat, adding an extra layer of taste to every bite.

ingredients.Name: Grilled sausages (e.g., kielbasa or your preferred variety)

directions.Direction: For the Cheesy Mashed Potatoes:
Boil the peeled and cubed potatoes until tender.
Drain the potatoes and mash them with milk, shredded cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper.
The result should be creamy, cheesy mashed potatoes. Set aside.
For the Shells
In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, water, oil, and egg.
Mix until a dough forms, then transfer it to a large bowl.
Cover the bowl with a towel and let the dough rest for at least 20 minutes.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
On a floured surface, roll the dough out thinly.
Cut out circles that will serve as the taco shell. These should be large enough to hold the filling and fold over.
Place a spoonful of the cheesy mashed potatoes onto one half of each dough circle.
Fold the other half of the dough over the filling, creating a semi-circle shape.
Seal the edges of the dough together, ensuring the filling is enclosed.
Place the assembled pierogi tacos in a metal taco holder or a baking dish.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the tacos are golden and slightly crispy.
For the Sausages
While the pierogi tacos are baking, grill the sausages until they reach an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C).
Cooking time will vary depending on the type and thickness of the sausages, but it's typically around 15-20 minutes.
For the Assembly
Mix mayonnaise with crushed black pepper to make the pepper mayo.
Warm the grainy mustard.
Once the pierogi tacos are baked, remove them from the oven.
Open each taco and fill it with slices of grilled sausage.
Top with pickled red cabbage, a drizzle of pepper mayo, and a dollop of grainy mustard.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Pierogi Taco
Description: The Pierogi Taco is a delightful fusion of Polish pierogi and Mexican tacos, offering a unique blend of flavors and textures. A homemade pierogi dough envelops a filling of cheesy mashed potatoes and is baked to perfection. Grilled sausage provides a savory and hearty element, while the toppings of pickled red cabbage, zesty pepper mayo, and grainy mustard add layers of complexity to this innovative culinary creation.

ingredients.Name: sweet onion (about 1 whole onion), finely chopped

directions.Direction: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of cooking oil.

Add the finely chopped sweet onions and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions become soft and golden brown. This should take about 15-20 minutes. Don't rush this step; slow caramelization adds depth to the jam's flavor.
Push the caramelized onions to one side of the skillet and add the remaining tablespoon of cooking oil to the other side.
Add the finely chopped smoked brisket to the skillet. Sauté the brisket for a few minutes until it's heated through and begins to absorb the onion's flavors.
Stir in the minced garlic, cayenne pepper, Worcestershire sauce, and brown sugar. Mix well to evenly distribute the flavors.
Add the apple cider vinegar to the skillet and stir to combine. Allow the mixture to simmer over low heat for about 15-20 minutes. This will help meld the flavors and thicken the jam's consistency.
Stir in the tablespoon of butter until it melts into the jam, adding a rich and velvety texture.
Taste the brisket jam and adjust the seasoning as needed. Add more salt, pepper, or cayenne according to your taste preferences.
Allow the brisket jam to cool to room temperature in the skillet before transferring it to clean, airtight jars or containers.

Use your delicious brisket jam as a savory condiment for sandwiches, burgers, grilled meats, or as a flavorful addition to charcuterie boards. It can also make a unique and thoughtful gift for food-loving friends!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Brisket Jam
Description: Brisket jam is a delightful and savory spread that combines the rich flavors of slow-smoked brisket with the sweetness of caramelized onions and a touch of tangy apple cider vinegar. This unique condiment offers a perfect blend of savory and sweet, making it a versatile topping for sandwiches, burgers, charcuterie boards, and more. The tender brisket is infused with the depth of garlic, cayenne, and Worcestershire sauce, while brown sugar adds a touch of sweetness. This recipe yields a delicious jam that's both comforting and bold.

ingredients.Name: rack of lamb (about 8 ribs), Frenched and trimmed

directions.Direction: Preheat your smoker to 275°F (135°C).
Season the rack of lamb generously with salt and pepper, ensuring an even coating on all sides.
In a food processor, combine garlic, breadcrumbs, parsley, and Parmesan cheese. Pulse until the mixture forms a coarse, well-blended texture.
Heat a skillet or cast-iron pan over high heat. Once hot, add a splash of oil.
Sear the rack of lamb for about 2 minutes on each side, or until nicely browned. This will create a flavorful crust.
Brush the seared lamb with Dijon mustard, creating a thin layer on the meat's surface.
Roll the lamb in the blended herb mixture, ensuring it adheres to the mustard-coated surface.
Place the herb-crusted lamb rack in the preheated smoker.
In a blender, combine fresh mint leaves and water. Blend until smooth. Strain the mixture into a spray bottle.
Spritz the lamb with the mint mixture 2 to 3 times during the cooking process, adding a burst of minty freshness to the flavors.
Smoke the lamb at 275°F (135°C) until the internal temperature reaches 140°F (60°C) for medium-rare doneness. Adjust the cooking time if you prefer a different level of doneness.
Once the lamb reaches the desired temperature, remove it from the smoker and let it rest for a few minutes.
Drizzle a touch of balsamic vinegar over the lamb rack before slicing.
Serve the herb-crusted lamb chops with your favorite side dishes and enjoy the harmonious blend of savory herbs, tender meat, and refreshing mint.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Rack of Lamb
Description: Indulge in the succulent flavors of American-raised lamb with this delectable herb-crusted rack of lamb recipe. The combination of savory herbs, crunchy breadcrumbs, and zesty Parmesan creates a delightful crust, while the gentle infusion of mint adds a refreshing twist. Searing the lamb locks in its natural juices, while a touch of balsamic vinegar drizzle adds the perfect finishing touch. Prepare to elevate your dining experience with this aromatic and tender dish.

ingredients.Name: beef short ribs, bone in slab
Salt and black pepper to taste

directions.Direction: Lay the beef short ribs slab on a clean surface.
Using a sharp knife, carefully cut the bones out of the ribs while keeping the meat intact.
Trim any excess fat and silver skin from the meat.
Generously season all sides of the meat with salt and black pepper. Ensure even coverage.
Take one of the removed bones and place it at the edge of the meat.
Gently roll the meat around the bone, creating a neat cylindrical shape.
Use butcher's twine to tie the meat securely around the bone. This will help the meat retain its shape during smoking.
Prepare your charcoal smoker for indirect cooking at a temperature of 225°F to 250°F (107°C to 121°C).
Add cherry wood chunks or chips to the charcoal for a smoky flavor.
Place the tied and seasoned ribs onto the smoker's grate.
Close the lid and smoke the ribs for several hours, maintaining a consistent temperature.
Smoke until the meat reaches an internal temperature of 160°F to 180°F (71°C to 82°C) or until a beautiful dark bark has developed. Place a drip pan underneath to catch fat drippings.
Once the desired bark has formed, carefully remove the ribs from the smoker.
Wrap the ribs tightly in aluminum foil or butcher paper, using some of the collected fat drippings to enhance moisture and flavor.
Return the wrapped ribs to the smoker and continue cooking until the internal temperature reaches around 200°F (93°C). This slow cooking stage will ensure tender and melt-in-your-mouth ribs.
Once the ribs have reached the desired internal temperature, remove them from the smoker.
Let the wrapped ribs rest for at least 1 hour. This resting period allows the juices to redistribute throughout the meat, ensuring maximum flavor and tenderness.
Carefully remove the twine and unwrap the ribs.
Slice the ribs between the bones into individual servings.
Serve your smoked beef short ribs with your favorite side dishes and savor the incredible flavors you've created.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Special Smoked Beef Short Rib
Description: Indulge in the rich and robust flavors of perfectly smoked beef short ribs. This recipe takes the succulent meat to another level by incorporating a deep smoky bark, achieved through slow smoking over charcoal and cherry wood. The bones are removed, and the meat is expertly seasoned, rolled, and tied, making it a true showstopper. The result is tender, flavorful beef with a crisp, smoky exterior that's sure to impress your taste buds.

ingredients.Name: red pepper flakes (adjust to your desired level of spiciness)
black tea leaves (oolong or lapsang souchong)
Cooking oil (such as vegetable or peanut oil) for frying

directions.Direction: For the Chili Oil Binder:
In a small bowl, combine the chili oil, toasted and ground Sichuan peppercorns, red pepper flakes, and soy sauce. Mix well and set aside.
For the Duck:

Pat the duck dry with paper towels. Rub the chili oil binder mixture all over the duck, ensuring it's evenly coated. In a separate bowl, mix together the garlic powder, ginger powder, MSG (if using), salt, and black pepper. Sprinkle this seasoning blend all over the duck, pressing it gently to adhere. Allow the duck to marinate for at least 30 minutes, or ideally, refrigerate it overnight for more flavor infusion.
Preheat your smoker to 160°F (70°C). Add the black tea leaves, pecan wood chips, and camphor wood pieces to the smoker's wood chip tray. Alternatively, you can use a stovetop smoking setup.

Place the seasoned duck on a wire rack inside the smoker, ensuring there's some space between the pieces to allow smoke circulation. Close the smoker and let the duck smoke for about 1 hour. The low temperature will allow the flavors to permeate the meat gradually.
Once the duck is smoked, remove it from the smoker and allow it to cool slightly. In a large pot or deep fryer, heat enough cooking oil to submerge the duck. Heat the oil to 350°F (175°C).

Gently lower the smoked duck into the hot oil using a fryer basket or tongs. Fry the duck for about 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally, until it turns golden brown and crispy. Using a meat thermometer, monitor the internal temperature of the duck. When it reaches 140°F (60°C), remove the duck from the oil and place it on a wire rack or paper towels to drain excess oil.

Allow the duck to rest for a few minutes before carving. Sprinkle a pinch of salt over the crispy skin, if desired. Carve the duck into serving portions and serve it alongside your favorite side dishes. The tender, smoky meat and crispy skin will surely delight your taste buds.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Tea Smoked Duck
Description: Indulge in the rich and aromatic flavors of tea-smoked duck, prepared with a tantalizing chili oil binder and a blend of savory seasonings. This culinary masterpiece combines the delicate smokiness of black tea leaves, the sweetness of pecan wood, and the unique essence of camphor wood, resulting in a dish that's both visually stunning and incredibly delectable. The duck is smoked to perfection at a low temperature, allowing the flavors to infuse gradually. Finish by frying to achieve a crispy exterior and tender, succulent meat with an internal temperature that's cooked to perfection.

ingredients.Name: Spicy Dan O's spice blend (or your preferred spicy seasoning)
jalapenos, seeds removed and finely chopped

directions.Direction: Preheat a rotisserie grill according to manufacturer's instructions.
Pat the chicken dry with paper towels.
Brush the chicken with chili oil, ensuring an even coating.
Generously season the chicken with the spicy Dan O's spice blend, covering all sides.

Place the seasoned chicken onto the rotisserie skewer and cook following the grill's instructions until the chicken is fully cooked and has a crispy, golden-brown skin. This usually takes about 1 to 1.5 hours, depending on the grill and chicken size.
Once cooked, remove the chicken from the grill and let it cool slightly. Then shred the chicken meat using forks or your hands. Set aside.
In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the chopped pickled red onions and jalapenos. Sauté for a few minutes until they soften.
Pour in the milk and stir to combine. Heat the mixture until it's hot but not boiling.
Gradually add the shredded spicy Monterey Jack cheese, stirring constantly until the cheese is fully melted and the sauce is smooth.
Season the cheese sauce with salt and pepper to taste. Keep warm.
Preheat your air fryer according to its instructions.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded chicken and the prepared cheese sauce. Mix until the chicken is evenly coated with the cheese sauce.
Carefully stuff each cooked jumbo pasta shell with the chicken and cheese mixture. Place the filled shells on a plate or tray.
Arrange the stuffed shells in the preheated air fryer basket, ensuring they're not overcrowded.
Air fry the shells at a moderate temperature (around 350°F or 180°C) for about 8-10 minutes, or until the shells are crispy and golden on the outside.
Once done, remove the shells from the air fryer and let them cool slightly before serving.
Serve the crispy Chicken Pollo Shells with a side of your favorite BBQ sauce for dipping.
Enjoy the delightful combination of flavors and textures in this unique and satisfying dish.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Chicken Pollo Shells
Description: Chicken Pollo Shells are a mouthwatering fusion of tender rotisserie chicken seasoned with a kick of spicy Dan O's spice blend, combined with a rich and flavorful cheese sauce made from pickled red onions, jalapenos, and spicy Monterey Jack cheese. This delightful mixture is stuffed into cooked pasta shells and air-fried to crispy perfection. The dish is served with a zesty BBQ sauce for dipping, creating a harmonious blend of flavors that's perfect for a satisfying meal.

ingredients.Name: neutral oil (such as canola or grapeseed oil)

directions.Direction: Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C).
Place the bone marrow segments on a baking sheet. You might want to place them on a wire rack for better airflow.
Roast the bone marrow in the preheated oven for about 40 minutes until they are softened and slightly golden. This will infuse the marrow with a smoky flavor.
Once the bone marrow is roasted, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool slightly.
Collect any drippings that have accumulated on the baking sheet. If needed, add enough neutral oil to the drippings to yield a full cup of oil. This oil will be the base of your mayo.
In a clean and dry jar or bowl, combine the egg yolks, Dijon mustard, white wine vinegar, and lemon juice.

Use a hand blender or immersion blender to blend the egg yolk mixture while slowly drizzling in the bone marrow-infused oil. Start with a slow drizzle and gradually increase the speed as the mayo begins to emulsify.
Blend until the mixture thickens and emulsifies into a creamy mayonnaise consistency. This should take a few minutes of blending.
Season the mayo with salt and pepper to taste. Remember that the bone marrow drippings might already contain some salt, so be cautious.
Taste the mayo and adjust the seasoning, adding more salt, pepper, or lemon juice if desired.
Transfer the bone marrow mayonnaise to a clean jar or airtight container.
Refrigerate the mayo for at least an hour before using to allow the flavors to meld together.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Bone Marrow Mayonnaise
Description: Elevate your condiment game with this rich and flavorful Bone Marrow Mayonnaise. Smoked bone marrow adds a unique depth of flavor to the traditional mayonnaise recipe, resulting in a creamy and luxurious spread that's perfect for sandwiches, dipping sauces, and more. The smoky undertones of the bone marrow beautifully complement the tangy notes of dijon mustard and lemon, making this mayo a truly special addition to your culinary creations.

ingredients.Name: of pig wings (pork shanks or mini pork hocks)
Nashville hot sauce (Sweet Baby Ray's or your preferred brand)

directions.Direction: Preheat your smoker to 250°F (120°C).
Pat the pig wings dry with paper towels. Season them generously with your rub of choice, ensuring even coverage.

Place the pig wings directly on the smoker grates. Close the smoker and let the wings smoke at 250°F for about 2 hours. The low and slow smoking will help the meat absorb the smoky flavor and become tender.
After the initial 2 hours of smoking, carefully remove the pig wings from the smoker.
Dip each wing into the Nashville hot glaze, ensuring they are well coated. You can use tongs to handle the wings.
Return the glazed wings to the smoker and let them smoke for an additional 30 minutes. This step will help the glaze set and become sticky.
Once the pig wings are fully cooked and the glaze is sticky, remove them from the smoker.
Drizzle a bit more Nashville hot sauce over the wings for an extra burst of flavor.
Sprinkle chopped fresh chives over the wings to add a touch of freshness and color.
Crumble blue cheese over the top, allowing its creamy and tangy notes to balance the heat of the glaze.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Pig Wings
Description: Indulge in the irresistible combination of smoky, succulent pig wings coated in a fiery Nashville hot glaze, perfectly balanced by the creamy tang of blue cheese and the freshness of chives. This recipe takes classic BBQ to the next level, creating a tantalizing dish that's sure to impress at any gathering. The initial slow smoke infuses the meat with deep flavors, while the glaze adds a spicy and sticky kick that's elevated by the final touch of herbs and cheese.

directions.Direction: For the Smoked Beef Cheeks
Preheat your smoker to 250°F.
Season the beef cheeks generously with salt and pepper on all sides.
Place the beef cheeks in the smoker and smoke for 4 hours, or until they are tender and infused with smoky flavor.
Remove the beef cheeks from the smoker and brush them with melted tallow or beef fat.
Wrap the beef cheeks tightly in aluminum foil and return them to the smoker. Smoke for an additional 2-3 hours to further enhance the flavor and tenderness.
Once finished shred the beef and set aside.
For the Dough
In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt.
Add the cubed cold butter and use a pastry cutter or your fingertips to work the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Gradually add cold water while stirring, until the dough comes together.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead it gently until it forms a smooth ball. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
For the Assembling and Frying:
Preheat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or a heavy-bottomed pot to 350°F.
Roll out the chilled dough on a floured surface to about 1/8-inch thickness.
Using a round cutter or a glass, cut out circles from the dough, each about 4-5 inches in diameter.
Place a spoonful of smoked beef cheek onto one half of each dough circle, leaving a small border around the edges.
Sprinkle shredded Monterey Jack cheese over the beef cheek filling.
Fold the other half of the dough over the filling to create a half-moon shape. Press the edges together and crimp with a fork to seal.
Carefully place the empanadas in the preheated oil and fry for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove the empanadas from the oil and let them drain on a paper towel-lined plate.

Serve the smoked beef cheek empanadas warm as a delicious appetizer, snack, or even a main course. These empanadas pair wonderfully with your favorite dipping sauces or salsas. Enjoy the unique blend of flavors and textures in each bite!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Beef Cheek Empanadas
Description: Indulge in the rich and savory flavors of these Smoked Beef Cheek Empanadas. Tender beef cheeks are infused with smokiness and encased in a crispy golden-brown dough, creating a perfect harmony of textures and tastes. The addition of melted Monterey Jack cheese adds a delightful creaminess that complements the hearty beef. These empanadas are an irresistible treat for gatherings or as a satisfying snack.

ingredients.Name: shredded cheddar cheese (plus extra for topping)

directions.Direction: Lay out a piece of parchment paper. Arrange half of the bacon slices vertically, touching each other. Fold back every other bacon strip halfway. Place a strip of bacon horizontally across the unfolded strips. Unfold the folded strips back over the horizontal strip. Fold back the alternate vertical bacon strips and lay another horizontal strip. Repeat this weaving pattern until a bacon weave sheet is formed. Set aside.
Place another piece of parchment paper over the sausage. Flatten the ground sausage into a rectangular shape slightly smaller than the size of the bacon weave.
Carefully transfer the sausage patty onto the center of the bacon weave. Gently peel off the parchment paper from the sausage.

In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and whisk to form a roux. Pour in milk while continuously whisking. Cook until the mixture thickens. Add shredded cheddar cheese, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. Fold in the cooked macaroni until well coated.

Spread the prepared mac and cheese over the sausage patty on the bacon weave. Sprinkle additional shredded cheese on top of the mac and cheese layer. Carefully roll up the bacon weave and sausage, enclosing the mac and cheese filling. Use cling wrap to wrap the roll tightly. Refrigerate for about an hour to set.
Preheat your smoker to 275°F. Place the mac and cheese bacon fatty on the smoker grate and close the lid. Smoke for about 2 to 2.5 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F.
About halfway through the smoking time, brush the mac and cheese bacon fatty with your favorite BBQ sauce for an added layer of flavor and a beautiful glaze.

Once the internal temperature reaches 160°F, carefully remove the mac and cheese bacon fatty from the smoker. Allow it to rest for a few minutes before slicing. Serve slices on a platter and enjoy the irresistible combination of flavors and textures.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Mac and Cheese Bacon Fatty
Description: Indulge in the ultimate comfort food creation with this Mac and Cheese Bacon Fatty recipe. A mouthwatering blend of crispy bacon, savory sausage, creamy mac and cheese, and smoky barbecue flavors, this dish is a true delight for your taste buds. The process involves crafting a bacon weave stuffed with a layer of sausage, generously filled with creamy mac and cheese, and then smoked to perfection. The result is a delectable, flavorful, and visually stunning dish that's perfect for a special gathering or a satisfying treat.

ingredients.Name: dried dill (or fresh dill, finely chopped)

directions.Direction: Drain the pickles from the jar and cut off both ends.
Use a small spoon or a knife to carefully core out the insides of the pickles, creating a hollow space for the filling. Reserve the cores.
For the Pickle Filling:
In a bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, shredded cheddar cheese, dried dill, and the finely chopped pickle cores.
Mix the ingredients thoroughly until a smooth and well-combined texture is achieved.
For the Dinosaur Eggs:
Using a piping tool, fill the hollowed pickles with the cream cheese mixture. Press gently to ensure they are evenly filled. Set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine the ground chicken, garlic powder, dried oregano, onion powder, salt, black pepper, and fresh dill. Mix well until the seasonings are evenly distributed.
Take a portion of the chicken mixture and flatten it in your hand.
Place a cream cheese-filled pickle in the center and wrap the chicken mixture around it, shaping it into an egg-like form. Ensure the pickle is completely covered by the chicken mixture.
Place the wrapped pickle eggs in the freezer until the chicken coating is firm, which usually takes about 1 hour.
Preheat your oven or smoker to 375°F.
Spread a thin layer of cream cheese over each chilled pickle-wrapped egg.
Roll the coated eggs in breadcrumbs until evenly coated.

Place the coated eggs on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake in the preheated oven or smoker for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the coating is golden and crispy.
Once cooked, remove the Dinosaur Eggs from the oven or smoker.
Serve them warm as a delightful and playful snack, appetizer, or party dish.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Dinosaur Eggs
Description: Transport yourself to a prehistoric world with these whimsical and delicious Dinosaur Eggs. These savory treats feature a surprising blend of flavors and textures, combining the tanginess of pickles with the creaminess of cheese and the satisfying crunch of breadcrumbs. The pickles are cored, filled with a delightful cream cheese and cheddar mixture, then enveloped in seasoned ground chicken before being coated with breadcrumbs for a crispy outer layer. Whether smoked or baked, these Dinosaur Eggs are a fun and flavorful addition to any gathering or snack time.

ingredients.Name: Your favorite rub or seasoning blend
ground sausage (pork or your preferred type)

directions.Direction: Slice each jalapeño at the stem and remove the seeds and membranes to reduce heat.
In a bowl, mix the softened cream cheese, shredded cheddar cheese, and your preferred seasoning until well combined.
Fill each jalapeño with the cheese mixture.
Take a portion of ground sausage and flatten it into a thin patty.
Place a stuffed jalapeño in the center of the sausage patty and carefully wrap the sausage around the jalapeño, covering it completely.
Wrap the sausage-covered jalapeño with a slice of bacon. Repeat for all the jalapeños.
Preheat your smoker or oven to 250°F (120°C).

If using a smoker, follow the manufacturer's instructions for smoking, using your choice of wood chips for flavor. If using an oven, place the wrapped jalapeños on a wire rack set over a baking sheet.
Smoke or bake the armadillo eggs for about an hour, or until the bacon is crispy.
While the armadillo eggs are smoking prepare the glaze in a small saucepan, and combine minced garlic, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, and honey.
Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until the mixture is well combined and slightly thickened.
After the armadillo eggs have cooked for an hour, brush or drizzle the glaze over each egg, ensuring they are evenly coated.
Continue cooking for an additional hour, allowing the glaze to caramelize and create a flavorful crust.
Once the centers of the armadillo eggs reach 160°F (71°C) and they are cooked to your desired level of doneness, remove them from the smoker or oven.
Sprinkle sesame seeds over the glazed armadillo eggs for an extra crunch and nutty flavor.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Asian Armadillo Eggs
Description: These Asian-inspired armadillo eggs take the classic jalapeño popper to a whole new level. Creamy, cheesy, and slightly spicy, these stuffed jalapeños are wrapped in flavorful sausage, then hugged by crispy bacon. Slow-cooked to perfection in a smoker or oven, they're finished with a sweet and tangy glaze that's infused with Asian flavors. Topped with sesame seeds, these armadillo eggs are a unique and delicious treat that combines the best of both worlds.

ingredients.Name: of mozzarella cheese, cut into sticks
chili flakes (adjust to your spice preference)
Oil for frying (if frying method is chosen)

directions.Direction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef with salt, pepper, garlic powder, chili flakes, dried parsley, and onion powder. Mix thoroughly until all the spices are evenly distributed.

Take a small portion of the seasoned ground beef mixture and flatten it on the palm of your hand. Place a stick of mozzarella cheese in the center and carefully wrap the ground beef around the cheese, ensuring it is completely covered. Repeat the process for the remaining cheese sticks.
Prepare three separate shallow dishes: one with all-purpose flour, one with the beaten egg, and the last one with bread crumbs.
Roll each meat-za-rella stick in the flour, then dip it into the beaten egg, and finally coat it thoroughly with bread crumbs, pressing gently to adhere the crumbs to the meat.
For the Frying Method:
In a deep frying pan or saucepan, heat oil to 350°F (175°C). You'll need enough oil to submerge the sticks partially.

Carefully drop the coated meat-za-rella sticks into the hot oil, cooking them in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan. Fry for about 8 minutes, turning occasionally until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Remove the cooked sticks from the oil and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any excess oil.
For the Air Frying Method:
Preheat your air fryer to 375°F (190°C).
Place the coated meat-za-rella sticks in the air fryer basket in a single layer, making sure they don't touch.
Air fry the sticks for approximately 10-12 minutes, turning them halfway through cooking for even browning.
For the Smoking Method:
Preheat your smoker to 225°F.
Place the coated meat-za-rella sticks directly on the smoker grates or on a wire rack.
Smoke the sticks for about 45-60 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 169°F.
For the Baking Method:
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place the coated meat-za-rella sticks on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in the preheated oven for approximately 20-25 minutes or until they turn golden brown and reach an internal temperature of 169°F.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Meat-za-rella Sticks
Description: Meat-za-rella sticks are a delightful twist on the classic mozzarella sticks. Instead of the traditional breadcrumb coating, these sticks are wrapped in a delicious mixture of seasoned ground beef, creating a meaty, cheesy treat that will satisfy all your cravings. Whether you decide to fry, air fry, smoke, or bake them, these Meat-za-rella sticks are sure to become a favorite appetizer or snack.

ingredients.Name: Cooking oil (e.g., vegetable or olive oil)
bone broth (for keeping moist during smoking)
The shredded meat from the smoked beef ribs

directions.Direction: Preheat your smoker to 275°F (135°C).
Coat the beef plate ribs with oil and generously season with your favorite beef rub.
Insert an internal thermometer into the thickest part of the beef.

Place the seasoned beef ribs on the smoker grate and smoke for several hours, approximately 4-6 hours, until the internal temperature reaches 200°F. Keep the meat moist by occasionally basting it with bone broth.
Once the beef ribs are fully cooked and tender, carefully remove the meat from the bones. Shred the beef into bite-sized pieces and set it aside.
In a large skillet or saucepan, combine the diced carrots, frozen peas, minced garlic, and diced onions.
Add the Worcestershire sauce, paprika, black pepper, and bone broth. Stir to combine.
Place the skillet over medium heat and bring the mixture to a simmer.
In a separate small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a little water to create a slurry. Stir the slurry into the simmering filling mixture.
Cook the filling for a few more minutes until it thickens and the vegetables are tender.
Add the shredded beef to the filling mixture and stir to combine. Set aside.
For the Assembly:
Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
On a clean, flat surface, lay down a small, solid piece of round pie crust.
Spoon a portion of the prepared filling onto the center of the pie crust, leaving a small space around the outside edges.
Carefully insert the bone of one smoked beef rib into the center of the filling. The bone will act as the lollipop stick.
Top the filling and bone with more of the prepared filling mixture.

Place another sheet of round pie crust on top of the filling, and seal the edges by pressing them together with a fork. Optionally, you can create a lattice-style top crust for a visually appealing finish.
Beat the egg in a small bowl and brush the top of the pie crust with the egg wash for a golden, shiny appearance.
Transfer the assembled beef pie lollipops onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in the preheated oven for approximately 30 minutes or until the crust turns golden brown and crispy.
Once baked, allow the beef pie lollipops to cool slightly before serving.
Serve these delightful beef pie lollipops as a fun and flavorful appetizer or a unique party snack.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Beef Pie Lollipop
Description: Beef Pie Lollipops are a unique and delicious twist on traditional beef pies. The dish features tender, smoky beef shredded off the bone of cow's ribs, which acts as the "stick" of the lollipop. The beef is seasoned with your favorite rub and slow-smoked until it reaches a juicy and succulent texture. The filling is a flavorful blend of carrots, peas, onions, garlic, and the shredded beef, all simmered in a savory sauce made with Worcestershire and bone broth. The lollipops are wrapped in flaky pie crust, forming a delightful handheld treat that is perfect for any occasion.

ingredients.Name: (4 5 pounds) boneless prime rib roast (no bone)

directions.Direction: Generously season the boneless prime rib roast with salt and garlic powder on all sides. Place the seasoned roast in the refrigerator to rest while you prepare the fire.
Build an open flame fire and let it burn until you have hot coals. The coals should be enough to maintain steady heat for an extended period.
Take the beef marrow bones and wrap them securely around the seasoned roast using butcher's twine. The bones should be tied evenly around the roast to resemble the cylinder of a revolver.

Insert a rotisserie through the center of the roast to hold it in place over the fire. Also, insert a wireless internal thermometer into the thickest part of the meat, ensuring it doesn't touch the bones.

Place the roast with the bone marrow bones on the rotisserie, allowing it to spin slowly over the hot coals. The heat will render the bone marrow, which will constantly coat the prime rib, enhancing its flavor.

In a cast iron pan placed near the fire, add additional beef marrow bones to render out their juices. You can use these rendered juices later to brush over the roast or enhance the flavor of side dishes.
As the roast cooks, occasionally brush it with a sprig of fresh rosemary to infuse the meat with an aromatic flavor.

Keep an eye on the internal temperature of the roast using the wireless thermometer. When the temperature reaches about 125 degrees Fahrenheit, remove the roast from the fire. The temperature will continue to rise as the roast rests, resulting in a perfectly cooked medium-rare prime rib.

Take the revolver prime rib inside and let it rest for about 15-20 minutes. During this time, the juices will redistribute throughout the meat. If you desire a crust on the outside, you can optionally use a torch to lightly sear the roast.
After resting, carefully remove the butcher's twine and bones from the roast. Slice the meat and drizzle it with the additional cooked marrow from the rendered bones.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Revolver Prime Rib
Description:
The Revolver Prime Rib is a show-stopping and indulgent meal that will leave your guests in awe. This no-bone roast is heavily seasoned with salt and garlic powder, creating a flavorful crust when seared. The centerpiece of the dish is the bone marrow bones wrapped and tied around the prime rib, infusing the meat with rich, succulent flavors as it slowly roasts over an open flame fire.

The rotisserie method ensures even cooking, and a wireless internal thermometer ensures the prime rib reaches the perfect medium-rare temperature. As the roast spins over the hot coals, the rendered bone marrow constantly coats the meat, enhancing its tenderness and adding an unforgettable depth of taste.

In addition to the roast, a cast iron pan is used to render out the juices from more beef marrow bones, creating a delectable sauce to brush over the meat or use as a flavor booster for accompanying side dishes.

With a brush of fresh rosemary and optional searing for a delightful crust, the revolver prime rib is a masterpiece of flavors and aesthetics. Once rested, the bone marrow-infused meat is sliced, and each serving is drizzled with the luscious cooked marrow for an extra burst of richness.

Whether it's a special occasion, a gathering with friends, or a holiday feast, the Revolver Prime Rib is an extraordinary and unforgettable meal that will delight all who have the pleasure of savoring it.

ingredients.Name: elbow macaroni or pasta of your choice

directions.Direction: For the Mac and Cheese:
In a large pot, bring salted water to a boil and cook the elbow macaroni according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a separate saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the flour and cook for about 1-2 minutes until it forms a roux.
Gradually add the milk to the roux, whisking constantly to avoid lumps. Cook the mixture until it thickens and comes to a simmer.
Lower the heat and stir in the shredded cheddar cheese, a little at a time, until fully melted and incorporated.
Add the cream cheese cubes to the cheese sauce, stirring until they melt completely.
Add the boiled noodles to the mixture, season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
For the Rib Crown:
Preheat your smoker to 250°F (121°C).
Season the rack of ribs generously with your favorite BBQ rub, ensuring all sides are coated.
Roll the rack into a circle to form a crown shape and secure it with butcher's twine, tying it at regular intervals.

Place the rib crown on the smoker rack and smoke for about 3 hours. After the first 3 hours, baste the ribs with BBQ sauce and return to the smoker for another 2 hours or until the ribs are tender and perfectly cooked.
Carefully remove the rib crown from the smoker and place it on a large serving plate.
Fill the center of the rib crown with the prepared mac and cheese, creating a mound within the crown shape.
Sprinkle the cooked and crumbled bacon on top of the mac and cheese.
Serve the delicious Rib Crown Mac and Cheese while still warm, allowing your guests to enjoy the perfect combination of smoky ribs, creamy mac, and savory bacon.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Rib Crown Mac and Cheese
Description:
Rib Crown Mac and Cheese is an indulgent and mouthwatering dish that brings together two beloved favorites: succulent smoked ribs and creamy macaroni and cheese. To create this delightful culinary masterpiece, a rack of ribs is meticulously seasoned with a flavorful BBQ rub, forming a unique crown shape. Slowly smoked at a low temperature, the ribs develop a tender and smoky essence that infuses each bite with irresistible richness.

Meanwhile, the mac and cheese component complements the savory ribs with its velvety, cheesy goodness. The luscious cheese sauce, made from cheddar and cream cheese, envelopes perfectly cooked pasta, resulting in a luxurious and comforting blend of flavors and textures.

When serving, the rib crown takes center stage, creating an eye-catching presentation. The center of the crown is generously filled with the creamy mac and cheese, creating a sumptuous fusion of sweet and smoky barbecue with the indulgent creaminess of the pasta.

Garnished with crispy bacon, the Rib Crown Mac and Cheese offers a delightful balance of smokiness, cheesiness, and savory goodness that will undoubtedly leave everyone craving for more. This dish is an excellent choice for gatherings, special occasions, or any time you want to impress your guests with a delectable and visually stunning creation that celebrates the art of barbecue and comfort food.

directions.Direction: For the Honey Glaze:
In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine minced garlic, soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, and honey.
Stir the mixture well and bring it to a simmer.
Let the glaze simmer until it thickens and becomes slightly sticky. This should take around 5-7 minutes.
For the Jalapenos:

Using a kitchen torch or over an open flame on a gas stove, carefully char the skin of the jalapenos until they are blackened and blistered. This process will help to make the jalapenos easier to peel and add a smoky flavor to the dish.

Use your hands or knife to gently rub off the blackened skin from the jalapenos. Slice off the stem end, and carefully make a lengthwise incision to remove the seeds and ribs. You should now have hollowed-out jalapenos ready for stuffing.
Preheat your oven or smoker to 400°F (200°C).
Rinse and pat dry the small scallops. Gently stuff scallops into each cored jalapeno until it fits snugly.
Take a strip of bacon and wrap it around each stuffed jalapeno lengthwise, and then another around widthwise.
Place the bacon-wrapped scallop-stuffed jalapenos on a baking sheet or smoker rack.
If using an oven, bake for about 20 minutes or until the bacon is crispy and the scallops are cooked through.
If using a smoker, smoke the jalapenos for approximately 20 minutes or until the bacon is nicely browned.
Remove the cooked jalapenos from the oven or smoker.
Using a basting brush, generously coat each jalapeno with the prepared honey glaze.
Return the glazed jalapenos to the oven or smoker and cook for an additional 10 minutes to allow the glaze to caramelize slightly.
Once done, remove the jalapenos from the heat and sprinkle sesame seeds over the top for added texture and flavor.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Scallop Stuffed Jalapenos
Description:
Scallops Stuffed Jalapenos with Honey Glaze is a delectable appetizer that combines the richness of small scallops, the heat of charred jalapenos, and the savory touch of bacon. The jalapenos are carefully torched to remove the skin, revealing a smoky flavor, and then cored to create a pocket for the tender scallops. Each jalapeno is wrapped in bacon, adding a crispy and savory element to the dish.

After baking or smoking to perfection, the stuffed jalapenos are generously coated with a glaze made from garlic, soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin, and honey. This glaze infuses the dish with a delightful balance of sweet and tangy notes, bringing out the best of each ingredient.

The final touch of toasted sesame seeds adds a delightful nuttiness and enhances the presentation. The result is a mouthwatering bite-size treat with a harmonious blend of flavors, textures, and a pleasant kick of heat. Scallops Stuffed Jalapenos with Honey Glaze are perfect for serving at gatherings or as a delightful indulgence any time you crave a sensational fusion of tastes.

ingredients.Name: Salt and black pepper, to taste

directions.Direction: Thaw the turkey completely if it was frozen. Ensure it is at room temperature before proceeding.
Lay the turkey breast-side down on a clean cutting board. Use a sharp knife to carefully remove the wings, spine, ribs, and legs, making sure not to puncture the skin.
Generously season the inside of the turkey with salt and black pepper, ensuring even coverage.
In a bowl, combine softened butter, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and Worcestershire sauce to make the glaze.
Bring the skin back over the insides, and use butcher's twine to tie the turkey tightly together, holding the skin and meat place.
Sprinkle a generous amount of salt evenly over the entire surface of the turkey skin.
Place the seasoned turkey on a roasting rack inside a baking dish. Let it rest in the refrigerator overnight to allow the flavors to meld.
The next day, prepare your smoker and preheat it to 275°F.
Place the boneless stuffed turkey directly on the smoker grates breast-side up.
Smoke the turkey at 275°F for about 4 to 5 hours or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. You can use a meat thermometer to monitor the temperature.
While the turkey is smoking, melt the remaining glaze in a saucepan over low heat.
Once the turkey has been smoking for an hour, baste it with the melted glaze every hour until it reaches the desired internal temperature.
Once the turkey reaches 165°F, remove it from the smoker and let it rest for about 20-30 minutes before carving.
Carve the boneless stuffed smoked turkey into beautiful slices and serve with your favorite side dishes.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Boneless Turkey
Description: The boneless stuffed smoked turkey is a culinary masterpiece that takes the traditional holiday dish to new heights. This impressive creation starts with a whole turkey carefully deboned and generously seasoned inside. The turkey is skillfully wrapped with its skin, ensuring the flavors are locked in while it cooks. Slowly smoked to perfection at 275°F, the tender and juicy meat absorbs the aromatic smokiness, resulting in a mouthwatering taste sensation. The glaze of butter, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and Worcestershire sauce enhances the turkey's succulence, providing a savory and buttery finish. This show-stopping boneless smoked turkey is sure to delight guests and make any occasion truly special.

ingredients.Name: cayenne pepper (adjust to your spice preference)

directions.Direction: Preheat your smoker to 225°F (107°C). Use hardwood charcoal or a combination of charcoal and wood chunks (such as hickory or oak) for the best smoke flavor.

Place the tri-tip on a clean work surface. Brush the entire surface of the tri-tip with the yellow mustard, ensuring an even coating. The mustard will help the seasoning adhere to the meat and add some tanginess to the final flavor.

In a small bowl, mix together all the seasoning rub ingredients. Generously sprinkle the seasoning rub over the mustard-coated tri-tip, making sure to coat all sides evenly and thoroughly. Gently pat the spices into the meat for better adherence.

Place the seasoned tri-tip on the smoker grate. Insert a meat thermometer probe into the thickest part of the meat, being careful not to touch bone or fat. Smoke the tri-tip until it reaches an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C). This will take around 2 to 3 hours, depending on the size of the tri-tip and your smoker's temperature consistency.

Once the tri-tip reaches 160°F, carefully remove it from the smoker and wrap it tightly in aluminum foil. Before sealing the foil, pour the melted butter over the tri-tip, ensuring it's well coated. This will add richness and moisture to the meat during the final stage of cooking.

Place the wrapped tri-tip back on the smoker and continue cooking until it reaches an internal temperature of 200°F (93°C). This will typically take an additional 1 to 2 hours, depending on the size of the tri-tip.

Once the tri-tip reaches the target internal temperature of 200°F, remove it from the smoker and let it rest in the foil for about 30 minutes. This resting period allows the juices to redistribute throughout the meat, resulting in a more tender and flavorful end product.
After resting, carefully unwrap the tri-tip, being mindful of the hot steam. Slice the smoked tri-tip brisket against the grain into thin, tender slices.
Arrange the sliced tri-tip on a serving platter, and it's ready to be served!

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Trisket (TriTip Brisket)
Description: This mouthwatering Smoked Tri-Tip Brisket is a delightful twist on the traditional tri-tip, incorporating the slow-cooking method of a brisket. The tri-tip is coated with a tangy mustard binder, enhancing the flavors while acting as a tenderizing agent. Generously seasoned with a mix of savory and smoky spices, the meat is then slow-smoked until it reaches an internal temperature of 160°F, ensuring a perfectly juicy and tender texture. At this stage, the tri-tip is removed from the smoker, covered in a luscious butter glaze, and returned to the smoker until it reaches an internal temperature of 200°F, creating an irresistibly rich and succulent finish. The end result is a beautifully caramelized, smoky, and fork-tender brisket-like tri-tip that will impress your guests and satisfy your cravings.

ingredients.Name: 1 rack of baby back ribs (approximately  pounds)

directions.Direction: For the Bacon Jam:
In a large skillet or saucepan, cook the diced bacon over medium heat until it becomes crispy and the fat has rendered out.
Remove the cooked bacon from the pan and set it aside. Keep the bacon fat in the pan.
Add the diced shallots to the pan and sauté them in the bacon fat until they become translucent.
Stir in the minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Pour in the balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, and maple syrup. Stir well to combine.
Return the cooked bacon to the pan and simmer the mixture over low heat until it thickens and becomes sticky, forming a jam-like consistency.
For the Ribs
Preheat your smoker to 250°F.
Remove the membrane from the back of the ribs for better tenderness and flavor penetration. Pat the ribs dry with paper towels.
Season the ribs generously with your favorite dry rub or a mixture of salt, pepper, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.
Place the seasoned ribs on the smoker grates and smoke at 250°F for approximately 3 hours. You can use your favorite smoking wood chips for extra flavor, such as hickory or applewood.
After 3 hours, remove the ribs from the smoker.
Lay out a large sheet of aluminum foil. Place the ribs on the foil and pour the apple juice over them.
Tightly wrap the ribs in the foil to create a sealed packet.
Return the wrapped ribs to the smoker and cook for another hour. This step helps tenderize the ribs and infuse them with the apple juice flavors.
Remove the ribs from the foil packet and place them back on the grill grates.
Spoon the prepared bacon jam generously over the top of the ribs, spreading it evenly to cover the entire surface.
Grill the ribs for an additional 10 minutes, allowing the bacon jam to caramelize and form a delicious crust on the ribs.
Remove the ribs from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing.
Serve the succulent bacon jam ribs with your favorite side dishes like coleslaw, cornbread, or grilled vegetables.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Bacon Jam RIbs
Description:
Bacon Jam Ribs are a mouthwatering and indulgent twist on classic smoked ribs. The process begins by seasoning the ribs with a flavorful dry rub and smoking them low and slow for three hours, infusing them with a rich smokiness. After this initial smoking, the ribs are wrapped in aluminum foil and bathed in apple juice, which further enhances their tenderness and imparts a subtle hint of sweetness.

The star of the show is the decadent bacon jam glaze, crafted by rendering diced bacon to perfection and sautéing shallots and garlic in the bacon fat. The mixture is then enriched with balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, and maple syrup, resulting in a sticky and savory jam that perfectly complements the smoky ribs. This jam is generously slathered over the ribs, creating a luscious caramelized crust as they finish grilling.

The end result is a tantalizing fusion of flavors - the succulent and tender ribs with a delightful balance of sweet and savory notes from the bacon jam. Each bite is an explosion of taste, making these Bacon Jam Ribs an unforgettable centerpiece for any barbecue or gathering. Whether you're a seasoned grilling enthusiast or a first-time cook, these ribs are sure to impress and leave your guests craving for more. Enjoy the irresistible combination of smoky, sticky, and utterly delicious goodness in every bite!

ingredients.Name: your favorite pork rub (store bought or homemade)
Smoking wood chips or chunks (hickory or fruitwood works well)
ripe mangoes, cut half, seed removed, and skin peeled
ripe mangoes, cut half, seed removed, and skin peeled

directions.Direction: For the Preparing the Pork Butt:
Preheat your grill or smoker to 225°F (107°C) for low and slow cooking.
Rub the pork butt all over with yellow mustard, ensuring it's coated evenly.
Generously season the pork with your favorite pork rub, massaging it into the meat for better flavor penetration.

Place the seasoned pork butt on the grill or smoker and let it smoke for several hours until it reaches an internal temperature of 195°F (90°C) and is tender enough to shred easily. This could take around 8-10 hours, depending on the size of the pork butt and your cooking setup.
During the smoking process, spray the pork butt with apple juice every hour to keep it moist and enhance the flavor.
For the Creating the Bacon Weave-Wrapped Mango Cups:
While the pork is smoking, prepare the mango cups. Cut the mangoes in half, twist out the seed, and peel off the skin.
Put each mango half together again and wrap with bacon, ensuring the entire surface is covered. Use toothpicks to secure the bacon in place.
Preheat your grill or smoker to medium-high heat (around 350°F/175°C).
Place the bacon-wrapped mango cups on the grill or smoker, and cook them until the bacon becomes crispy and the mangoes soften. This should take approximately 15-20 minutes.
For the Assembling the Hawaiian Scotch Eggs:
Once the pork butt has reached the desired tenderness, remove it from the grill or smoker. Let it rest for a few minutes before shredding it using two forks.
Cut each bacon-wrapped mango in half exposing the cavity where the pit was.
Fill each cavity with a generous amount of the tender pulled pork, pressing it down gently to create a compact filling.
Drizzle your favorite barbecue sauce over the top and serve.
For the Serving:
Once the Hawaiian Scotch Eggs are ready, remove them from the grill or smoker.
Serve the hot and delicious Scotch eggs on a platter and garnish with some fresh cilantro or your favorite tropical fruit for an extra burst of color and flavor.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Hawaiian Scotch Eggs
Description: Hawaiian Scotch Eggs are a tropical twist on the classic Scotch eggs, featuring succulent pulled pork stuffed inside juicy mango cups and wrapped in a crispy bacon weave. The combination of sweet mango, smoky pulled pork, and savory bacon creates a mouthwatering treat perfect for grilling or smoking. Slathered in mustard and seasoned with a delicious pork rub, these Hawaiian Scotch Eggs will be a hit at your next barbecue or gathering.

ingredients.Name: Green Carolina hot sauce (store bought or homemade)
jalapeno lime rub (store bought or homemade)

directions.Direction: For the Prep the Pork Belly Strips:
Cut pork belly into 1.5-inch wid strips.
Pat the pork belly strips dry using paper towels.
In a large bowl, coat the pork belly strips thoroughly with Green Carolina hot sauce, ensuring each strip is well-covered.
Sprinkle the jalapeno lime rub over the hot sauce-coated pork belly strips, making sure they are evenly seasoned. Allow the strips to marinate for at least 30 minutes, preferably in the refrigerator.
For the Smoke the Pork Belly

Preheat your smoker to 225°F (107°C) following the manufacturer's instructions. Use your choice of smoking wood chips or chunks (e.g., hickory, applewood, or cherry) to add a desirable smoky flavor to the pork belly strips.
Place the marinated pork belly strips on the smoker racks, leaving some space between them for even smoking.

Smoke the pork belly strips at 225°F (107°C) for about 4 hours, or until they reach an internal temperature of 190°F (88°C). The low and slow smoking process will result in tender and flavorful pork belly.
After 4 hours of smoking, carefully remove the pork belly strips from the smoker.
Skewer each strip lengthwise, ensuring they hold their shape during the next cooking phase.
Place the skewered pork belly strips in a metal drip tray or a foil-lined baking dish.
Top the pork belly strips with the cubed butter and pour the sauce over them, making sure they are fully coated.
Cover the tray or dish tightly with aluminum foil.
Return the covered pork belly strips to the smoker or oven set at 225°F (107°C).
Cook for an additional hour, allowing the flavors to meld and the pork belly strips to become even more tender and infused with the sauce.
Once the hour is up, carefully remove the foil, and the succulent pork belly strips are ready to be served.
Garnish with some fresh chopped cilantro and a lime wedge for an extra burst of freshness and visual appeal.
For the Sauce:
While the pork belly strips are smoking, combine pickle juice, lime juice, brown sugar, and jalapeno lime rub in a small saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer over medium heat and let it reduce for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. The mixture should thicken slightly.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Spicy Pork Belly
Description: Get ready for a mouthwatering and spicy culinary adventure with these smoked pork belly strips coated in zesty Green Carolina hot sauce and a flavorful jalapeno lime rub. Slow-smoked to perfection, the pork belly becomes tender and juicy, infused with the delicious smoky essence from the smoker. The final touch of simmering in a tangy mixture of pickle juice, lime juice, brown sugar, and more jalapeno lime rub adds an explosion of flavors that will leave your taste buds craving for more. This recipe is perfect for a barbecue gathering or any occasion where you want to impress your guests with a unique and bold dish.

ingredients.Name: Your favorite BBQ seasoning or dry rub

directions.Direction: For the Prepare the Chicken Lollipops:

Carefully cut the skin around the bone of each drumstick using a sharp knife. Gently push and pack the chicken meat towards the thicker end of the bone, forming a lollipop shape. This will expose more of the bone, making them easier to hold and eat.
Season the chicken drumsticks generously with your chosen BBQ seasoning or dry rub, ensuring even coverage.
For the Smoking the Chicken:
Preheat your smoker to 375°F (190°C).
Hang the seasoned chicken drumsticks on the smoker rack, meat side down, ensuring they are well-spaced to allow even smoking.
Place a tin foil tray underneath the drumsticks to catch any drippings and prevent flare-ups.
Smoke the chicken until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C), which typically takes around 1 to 1.5 hours, depending on your smoker and the size of the drumsticks.
For the Applying the BBQ Sauce:
Once the chicken has reached the desired internal temperature, carefully remove them from the smoker.
Using a basting brush, paint a generous layer of your favorite BBQ sauce onto each drumstick, coating them evenly.
For the Making the Candy Glaze:
In a small saucepan, combine the granulated sugar and water, stirring gently over medium heat until the sugar dissolves completely.

Increase the heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a boil. Allow it to boil without stirring until the temperature reaches 300°F (150°C) on a candy thermometer. The sugar will caramelize and turn into a glossy candy glaze.
For the Coating the Chicken Lollipops:
Once the candy glaze reaches the desired temperature, quickly dip each BBQ-sauced chicken drumstick into the hot glaze, coating them entirely. Be careful as the glaze will be extremely hot.
To set the candy glaze quickly, immediately dip the coated drumsticks into a bowl of ice water. The glaze will harden into a sweet and crunchy shell.

Serve and Enjoy: Arrange the Candy Coated Chicken Lollipops on a serving platter, and they are ready to be devoured. The combination of smoky, saucy, and sweet flavors will make these lollipops a hit at any party or gathering.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Chicken Lollipops
Description: Candy Coated Chicken Lolipops are a unique and delicious twist on traditional smoked chicken drumsticks. The process involves cutting the skin around the bone and packing the meat towards the end of the drumstick, giving them a lollipop-like appearance. The chicken is then seasoned, smoked, and finally coated with a sweet and sticky candy glaze. The combination of smoky, savory, and sweet flavors creates an irresistible treat that will leave your taste buds dancing.

ingredients.Name: dill paste (or finely chopped fresh dill)

directions.Direction: Preheat the Smoker: If using a smoker, preheat it to 80°C with your preferred smoking wood chips (such as hickory or applewood) for added flavor. If you don't have a smoker, you can use a grill with indirect heat and a smoke box or use a stovetop smoking method.
Wrap the Shrimp with Salmon: Take each jumbo shrimp and wrap it tightly with one slice of thinly sliced salmon.

Smoke the Shrimp and Salmon: Place the shrimp bundles on the smoker rack or the grill grates away from direct heat. If using a smoker, smoke the shrimp for about 60 minutes or until they are cooked through and the salmon has a slight crisp on the outside. If using a grill, cook the shrimp over indirect heat for a similar duration while keeping the lid closed to retain the smoky flavor.

Prepare the Butter-Dill-Roasted Garlic Sauce: In a small bowl, combine the softened butter, dill paste, and mashed roasted garlic. Mix well until all the ingredients are thoroughly incorporated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set the sauce aside or refrigerate it if prepared in advance.

Coat Shrimp with the Butter-Dill-Roasted Garlic Sauce: Once the shrimp and salmon bundles have cooked for 60 minutes drizzle the Butter-Dill-Roasted Garlic Sauce over the smoked jumbo shrimp wrapped in salmon.
Continue Cooking: Increase the smoker temperature to 105°C and cook for another 20 minutes.
Garnish and Enjoy: For a final touch, garnish the dish with a sprig of fresh dill. Serve the smoked jumbo shrimp wrapped in salmon while still warm, and savor the delightful combination of flavors.

Creator: jortskitchen
Name: Sea Wings/Mermaid Tails
Description: Indulge in the exquisite flavors of smoked jumbo shrimp delicately wrapped in a thin layer of succulent salmon, served with a delectable butter-dill-roasted garlic sauce.
